channel.itunes:subtitle: Beauty journalists (and friends!) Jessica Matlin and Jennifer Sullivan turn up the volume and bring you the big, juicy, world of beauty twice a week. On Tuesday episodes, they share their insider access to the beauty industry, candid stories of their b...
channel.itunes:summary:
Beauty journalists (and friends!) Jessica Matlin and Jennifer Sullivan bring you the big, juicy world of beauty twice a week. On Wednesdays, they share their insider access to the industry, discuss news and culture through the lens of beauty, and talk about their beauty adventures as well as their favorite fragrances, skincare, and makeup. On Fridays, they interview their favorite people in the business, including celebrities, makeup artists, perfumers, dermatologists, plastic surgeons, and more. Delivered with a heavy dose of fun, Fat Mascara is where beauty obsessives can get their fix.

Become a member at https://plus.acast.com/s/fatmascara.


Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

item.title: Ep. 450: Sexy, Expensive & Controversial with Makeup Artist Marcelo Gutierrez
item.itunes:title: Ep. 450: Sexy, Expensive & Controversial with Makeup Artist Marcelo Gutierrez
item.description:
Makeup artist and filmmaker Marcelo Gutierrez does sexy, expensive, and sometimes controversial work, but never without sensitivity. Jess talks to him about his serendipitous start in the business, his celebrity clientele (Dua Lipa, Lily-Rose Depp), his influences, and how his identity informs his art.

item.title: Ep. 449: Olivia Wilde Says She's From Another Planet (Replay)
item.itunes:title: Ep. 449: Olivia Wilde Says She's From Another Planet (Replay)
item.description:
Filmmaker and actress Olivia Wilde is here to talk about her beauty growing pains, adventures in hair dye and microblading, raising her daughter to have a healthy relationship with beauty, and more. Plus, she tells Jenn how and why she became a "brand activist" for True Botanicals (Jess was busy with all things Fashion Week when we recorded). FYI: This interview originally aired in September, 2018. We’ll be back on Friday with all new episodes!

item.title: Ep. 448: Hair Relaxers, Cosmetic Injectables & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 448: Hair Relaxers, Cosmetic Injectables & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
We’ve got the details on a new study that found a connection between hair relaxers and uterine cancer, plus an update on the makeup-free Miss England contestant and some thoughts on Jared Leto. After that, we’re talking about current trends in cosmetic injectables with Samantha Kerr, PhD, the chief science officer of Merz Aesthetics, in a segment sponsored by Xeomin, an FDA-approved treatment used to temporarily improve the look of moderate to severe frown lines between the eyebrows (glabellar lines) in adults. Education about aesthetic treatments! We love to see it!

  • To learn more about Xeomin, find a provider near you, and read the full prescribing information, visit: XeominAesthetic.com

item.title: Ep. 447: Aromatherapy Can Do That with Denise LaPalm
item.itunes:title: Ep. 447: Aromatherapy Can Do That with Denise LaPalm
item.description:
Anxiety? Stress? Aromatherapy can help with that—and also pain management, lack of energy, and so much more. Certified aromatherapist Denise LaPalm, the founder (and Chief Stress Officer!) of L'Beauxtique is here to talk about the difference between essential oils and carrier oils, share some of her favorite oils and tips for getting a better night’s sleep, and explain why not all aromatherapists love lavender.

item.title: Ep. 446: Top 10 Perfumes, Beauty’s Dumping Ground & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 446: Top 10 Perfumes, Beauty’s Dumping Ground & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
You know we love a quiz, so indulge us while we discuss our recent seasonal color analyses and how much we learned (there's also a Color Guru discount code if you want to get your colors done!). Then, let’s discuss the beauty industry’s dirty secret: Many unused cosmetic formulas get thrown out. Now, one company may have a solution to the problem. Plus, we share the Top 10 perfumes in the U.S.; talk about a new study showing how makeup makes you more attractive; and report on a dermatologist who wants his patients to use AI skin analysis.

item.title: Ep. 445: Gen Z Beauty Trends with Marina Mansour
item.itunes:title: Ep. 445: Gen Z Beauty Trends with Marina Mansour
item.description:
What are the skintellectuals putting on their faces? Why is the “clean girl” aesthetic problematic? Is Beauty (with a capital B) becoming more democratic? Marina Mansour, vice president of beauty and wellness for the Gen Z entertainment company Kyra, guides us through the state of beauty for Gen Z (teens and young adults ages 13 - 25 in 2022). Enjoy the sharp trend analysis and helpful beauty advice—but also the glazed-donut nails, glowy sunscreen, and vanilla-scented perfume.

item.title: Ep. 444: How 24-7 Camera Culture Affects Beauty Standards & This Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 444: How 24-7 Camera Culture Affects Beauty Standards & This Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
What does seeing our own faces all day long mean for the future of makeup application, our mental health, and more? Let’s talk about it. Plus: passport photo makeup; Dove’s study of toxic beauty standards; how perfume made its way into video games; why Dua Lipa is investing in a beauty brand instead of starting one; Ozzy Osbourne’s limited-edition makeup. And thank you to all the listeners who are submitting their fall fragrance recommendations! We’ll share a few.

item.title: Ep. 443: How to Live Your Best Half with Naomi Watts
item.itunes:title: Ep. 443: How to Live Your Best Half with Naomi Watts
item.description:
Actress Naomi Watts wants to have a conversation about menopause—and we are here for it! We chat about cultural attitudes toward aging, whether the “last f**kable day” is still a thing, why menopause was a taboo topic for our moms and their moms, and why that needs to change. Plus, she shares the secrets she’s learned to living her best half (aka, the second half of her life); how she’s dealt with all the changes that happen “scalp to vag” before, during, and after menopause; her new brand, Stripes; and some of her favorite beauty products.

  • Products & people mentioned on Ep. 443: shopmy.us/collections/77586
  • Episode recap, links, and sponsor promo codes: fatmascara.com/blog

item.title: Ep. 442: Flesh-Colored Water, Hugimals & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 442: Flesh-Colored Water, Hugimals & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
This podcast is for “all the beauties,” as Olivier Rousteing likes to say. We’re talking about his Balmain beauty play; the Gen X and millennial natural brands staging comebacks; Beauty Pie’s new refillable Unlipstick; and our dislike of foundation that’s too sheer (flesh-colored water) & lipstick that’s not comforting (lip-colored water). Plus, let’s raise some wands to two amazing fall fragrances and Hugimals, the weighted stuffed animals we’re obsessed with.

item.title: Ep. 441: How Traditional Chinese Medicine Can Help Your Skin With Sandra Lanshin Chiu
item.itunes:title: Ep. 441: How Traditional Chinese Medicine Can Help Your Skin With Sandra Lanshin Chiu
item.description:
What’s the difference between gua sha, face-rolling, lymphatic drainage, face massage, and facial exercise? And what can these techniques actually do for your skin? Acupuncturist and Chinese herbalist Sandra Lanshin Chiu is here to tell us. Plus, she explains some of the principles of Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM), tells us about the cultural history of facial gua sha, and shares her favorite facial mists and oils.

item.title: Ep. 440: What Scientists Learned from the Beauty Behaviors of 93,158 People & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 440: What Scientists Learned from the Beauty Behaviors of 93,158 People & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
Jess’s co-working space smells like Le Labo, Jenn tried a “body-remodeling” treatment, and evolutionary scientists learned some fascinating things about why humans beautify themselves (e.g., apply makeup, bathe, etc.) from a huge global survey. We’re also talking about the viral post from a hair stylist who was fed up with know-it-all clients; a stinky perfume factory in Florida; Danessa Myricks's genius Blurring Balm Powder; the Beauty of Joseon sunscreen worth the hype; and The Best Pencil from Jones Road. Plus: Have you heard? Brad Pitt and Travis Barker launched skincare lines.

item.itunes:title: Ep. 439: How Dr. Shereene Idriss Became the PillowtalkDerm
item.description:
Board-certified dermatologist Shereene Idriss, MD, is here to share everything she learned about beauty industry B.S. while she was creating her new skincare line, PillowtalkDerm. She explains how product development usually works (and how it should work), why the language on skincare products is so confusing, the reason she decided to focus on melasma and discoloration, and how to find other #skinfluencers you can trust online. Plus: She shares her favorite makeup, sunscreen, and perfume—and the best eyeliner for the Chocolate Brown Years.

item.title: Ep. 438: Skin Cycling, Makeup-Free Miss England, Daxxify & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 438: Skin Cycling, Makeup-Free Miss England, Daxxify & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
Should you be cycling your skincare? And is it just a fad or actually good for your complexion? We discuss! Plus, let’s talk about the first Miss England contestant to compete without makeup; the cosmetic injectable Daxxify; water-based perfume; Emface (a non-invasive facial tightening treatment); and why ColourPop Cosmetics thought a collaboration with J.K. Rowling’s Harry Potter was a good idea. Plus, a listener tried Hailey Bieber’s favorite Paula Choice serum and tells us how it went.

item.title: Ep. 437: How to Enjoy Being Naked, with Emily Morse
item.itunes:title: Ep. 437: How to Enjoy Being Naked, with Emily Morse
item.description:
Sexologist Emily Morse, host of the Sex With Emily podcast, is here to talk about body enjoyment. She explains how to feel more confident naked (her tips are helpful, we swear!), the truth about why porn stars in XXX films look the way they do, why there’s a stigma around using lube, and which beauty products can actually make people feel sexier. Plus, there’s lots of great sex advice, like how to talk to your partner about their body (and your body), how to get more of what you want, and the reason communication is the best lubrication.

item.title: Ep. 436: Social Selling, #NYFW & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 436: Social Selling, #NYFW & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
We’ve got a full recap of New York Fashion Week and all the latest beauty trends—and by “full recap” we mean a summary of the one party your intrepid Fat Mascara hosts attended together. Plus, we’re talking about Kate Moss’s new line; Gwen Stefani’s brand, Gxve, and its decision to use a social-selling format; Amorepacific acquiring Tata Harper; and the end of Allure’s print magazine. We’ll also raise wands to a body wash that is almost too good to be created by a celebrity, a gorgeous hair oil, and an eyeliner for the Chocolate Brown Years.

item.title: Ep. 435: Makeup Artist Katie Jane Hughes Is Her Own Canvas
item.itunes:title: Ep. 435: Makeup Artist Katie Jane Hughes Is Her Own Canvas
item.description:
There was a time when makeup artists wouldn’t think of showcasing their work on their own faces, but Katie Jane Hughes helped to change that. In this wide-ranging interview, she shares how she went from aspiring singer to manicurist to makeup artist to creator and—by next spring, if all goes according to plan!—founder of her own line. Plus, Katie, who works with celebrities like Ashley Graham and Rosie Huntington-Whiteley, spills the secret to glowy cheeks (it’s not makeup), and shares how to use some of her favorite products, including her new go-to mascara (Ami Cole), the Ere Perez lip crayon that won't dry out your lips, and the Glossier concealer she calls “tinted moisturizer in a pot.”

item.title: Ep. 434: How to Treat Rosacea (a Science Corner Special)
item.itunes:title: Ep. 434: How to Treat Rosacea (a Science Corner Special)
item.description:
Dermatologist Estee Williams, MD, is here to answers all your questions about rosacea. We discuss how much laser treatments for rosacea cost (and how they help), which skincare ingredients cause rosacea flare-ups, why topical green tea and azelaic acid might help, which prescription rosacea treatments actually work, how diet changes can reduce rosacea symptoms, and how the bacteria in your small intestine and the lil’ mites on your skin (demodex) could contribute to the condition. You’ll learn a ton about your skin in this Science Corner special—even if you don’t have rosacea.

item.title: Ep. 433: Making (Beauty & Health) Choices with Whitney Cummings
item.itunes:title: Ep. 433: Making (Beauty & Health) Choices with Whitney Cummings
item.description:
Comedian Whitney Cummings is her to discuss how she makes decisions about her appearance and who has a say in what women do to their bodies when it comes to things like plastic surgery, cosmetic injectables, and even birth control (she’s a spokesperson for Annovera). In this wide-ranging chat, she and Jenn discuss topical colostrum, nose filler, Ulthera, Botox, whether she should get corrective pigment camouflage (aka permanent makeup) for her scars, hair color experiments, the sweat-hiding power of a denim jacket, vintage perfume, and more.

item.title: Ep. 431: How Makeup Artist Terri Bryant Brought Universal Design to the Beauty Industry
item.itunes:title: Ep. 431: How Makeup Artist Terri Bryant Brought Universal Design to the Beauty Industry
item.description:
We promised today’s guest, makeup artist Terri Bryant, that we would title this episode of the podcast “Makeup Artist Develops Revolutionary, Universally Designed Products That Make Makeup Artistry Better and Easier for Everyone”—but it was too long to fit! However, that’s exactly what Terri's done with her line, Guide Beauty. After receiving a diagnosis of Parkinson’s disease, Terri began working with experts in Universal Design and Inclusive Design to rethink makeup products and make them easier for people with mobility issues to use—which, of course, made them easier for everyone! Listen in as Terri shares her story, teaches us about the everyday products that owe their existence to pioneers of Universal Design, and explains why she’s on a mission to make applying cosmetics easier for everyone.

item.title: Ep. 430: The Truth About Hair Products With Sister Scientist Erica Douglas (Replay)
item.itunes:title: Ep. 430: The Truth About Hair Products With Sister Scientist Erica Douglas (Replay)
item.description:
Can you become immune to a shampoo? Is silicone really that bad? Do you actually need a heat protectant? Cosmetic chemist Erica Douglas, aka @SisterScientist, is here to answer all those questions, demystify the confusing world of hair products, and share some of her favorite stylers, treatments, shampoos, and more. FYI: This podcast features a new introduction, but the interview originally aired in March, 2021. We'll be back with all-new episodes on August 26!

item.title: Ep. 429: Lisa Eldridge Teaches You To Be Your Own Makeup Artist (Replay)
item.itunes:title: Ep. 429: Lisa Eldridge Teaches You To Be Your Own Makeup Artist (Replay)
item.description:
This week’s episode with Lisa Eldridge will inspire you to be your own makeup artist! Lisa, who says she “loves faces,” grew up finding beauty and color in everything she saw. She tells us how she’s inspired by art and the world around her, and how she knows which faces will be “makeup eaters” and which won’t. She also shares the backstory of her YouTube channel, including her initial hesitation with making videos and how she overcame self doubt. FYI: This podcast features a new introduction, but the interview originally aired in July, 2020. We'll be back with all-new episodes on August 26!

item.title: Ep. 428: How Special-Effects Teeth Are Made For Movies with Gary Archer (Replay)
item.itunes:title: Ep. 428: How Special-Effects Teeth Are Made For Movies with Gary Archer (Replay)
item.description:
Dental technician Gary Archer has made specialized teeth for hundreds of movies and TV shows, including Austin Powers, PEN15, The Wolf of Wall Street, Mrs. Doubtfire, Interview with the Vampire, and more. He explains how he collaborates with Special FX makeup artists to create a character's look and tells us which movie smiles he’s made that you probably didn’t realize were fake. Plus, he shares stories from his work with actors like Kirsten Dunst, Tom Hanks, Adam Sandler, and others. FYI: This podcast features a new introduction, but the interview originally aired in February, 2021. We'll be back with all-new episodes on August 26!

item.title: Ep. 427: Butt Lifts, Tummy Tucks & More with Plastic Surgeon Dr. Ryan Neinstein
item.itunes:title: Ep. 427: Butt Lifts, Tummy Tucks & More with Plastic Surgeon Dr. Ryan Neinstein
item.description:
What body changes are possible with plastic surgery? Dr. Ryan Neinstein, MD, is here to tell us. He explains how he sculpts bodies with liposuction, EmSculpt, breast boosts, fat transfer, tucks, “mommy makeovers,” Brazilian (and non-Brazilian!) butt lifts, and more. He also tells us why he won’t do CoolSculpting, shares tips for finding a surgeon and getting the most out of a surgical procedure—and reveals the surprising reason why some celebrities’ waists look so tiny.

item.itunes:title: Ep. 425: The Art of Small Beauty with Makeup Artist Dick Page
item.description:
For more than 30 years, makeup artist Dick Page has been playing with color and painting the faces of everyone from Christy Turlington to Bella Hadid. In this interview, he talks about his career, the disappearing art of subtlety, how the way we view images today has changed the way we think about beauty, and the not-so-secret trick for achieving one of his signature looks: dewy, balmy, glowing cheeks.

item.description:
Jenn shares a makeup artist’s tips for applying eyeshadow that she and Jess had never heard before. Plus, a new report found that some CBD skincare products unknowingly contain THC (and one researcher has raised concerns that using them could potentially cause someone to fail a drug test!). item.description:
Professional housekeeper Vanesa Amaro is here to organize your home and bathroom—and answer all your beauty-related cleaning questions. How do you clean a hairbrush? What’s the best way to sanitize a makeup bag? What removes makeup fingerprints from doors? Which cleaning products should you use if you’re sensitive to fragrance? How do you get rid of the gunk on your electric-toothbrush charger? Vanesa—aka the Queen of Clean on TikTok—has all the answers. Plus, she shares her secret for a manicure that lasts two weeks and the technique that sets her makeup for 18 hours.

item.title: Ep. 421: Cat Marnell is Healthy, Happy, and Still Obsessed with Beauty Products
item.itunes:title: Ep. 421: Cat Marnell is Healthy, Happy, and Still Obsessed with Beauty Products
item.description:
We catch up with former beauty editor Cat Marnell, the author of How to Murder Your Life and creator of the Patreon column Beautyshambles. She reminisces about the heyday of magazines and tells us she's ready for her next creative endeavor now that she’s healthy (she says she wishes she could use the word “sober” because she's "so close"). We discuss how her relationship with her appearance changed during rehab, and talk about $4,000 pillows, $3 eyeliners, and what she and her friends (Julia Fox, Leah McSweeny, Rachel Rabbit White, et al.) do for fun.

Rihanna-approved facialist Sean Garrette tells us how he went from cosmetology school in Atlanta to his current position as Dior Beauty’s U.S. skincare expert in just a few years. item.description:
This interview with hair stylist and brand founder Kristin Ess is a masterclass in all things beauty and brand building. She gets real about managing business relationships, pulls back the curtain on how celebrity-client partnerships actually work, and shares tips for making your hair work for you, no matter the texture or length. We also chat about some of her favorite beauty products, making pottery, her candle obsession, and the dress that everyone needs in their closet (Kristin has eight of them).

item.title: Ep. 414: Ability-Inclusive Makeup, a Rhode Review & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 414: Ability-Inclusive Makeup, a Rhode Review & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
After a quick J&J catch-up, we’ve got snow mushroom extract, squalane, and so much more to discuss, including Guide Beauty, a company making cosmetics that are easier to use if you have a disability or health condition that impacts mobility, motor skills, or hand-eye coordination. Plus: Revlon’s bankruptcy filing, the Humanrace sunscreen (available July 14), makeup artist Isamaya Ffrench’s new line (available end of June), and a quickie review of Rhode skincare (recorded before the trademark lawsuit was filed, btw).

item.title: Ep. 412: Lash Serum Side Effects, Probiotics, Gym Lips & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 412: Lash Serum Side Effects, Probiotics, Gym Lips & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
An ophthalmologist explains why cosmetic lash serums like Grande Cosmetics GrandeLASH-MD may cause drug-like side effects, such as fat loss that leads to a change in eye shape. Before that, Jess recaps the Fragrance Foundation awards and Jenn has thoughts on gym lips and a few other viral beauty trends. Plus, we discuss three beauty brands that are dropping their prices; Dr. Whitney Bowe’s new skincare line; research showing probiotic lotions may be better than benzoyl peroxide for treating acne; and the man who set a world record for the largest collection of perfume factices (they’re on display at an exhibition space in New Jersey, and you can book an appointment to visit).

item.title: Ep. 411: Tracee Ellis Ross On The Power Of Beauty (Replay)
item.itunes:title: Ep. 411: Tracee Ellis Ross On The Power Of Beauty (Replay)
item.description:
Award-winning actor Tracee Ellis Ross, founder of the haircare line Pattern, gets candid about her hair, your hair, customer reviews, ageism in Hollywood, experiments with DIY waxing, her love of Funyuns and red lipstick, her hatred of flaky hair gels, and her love/hate of home workouts. Plus, she shares behind-the-scenes secrets from Black•ish, Mixed•ish, and The High Note. This interview originally aired in August, 2020. We’ll be back next week with all new episodes!

item.title: Ep. 409: Let’s Talk About Age with Kim France
item.itunes:title: Ep. 409: Let’s Talk About Age with Kim France
item.description:
How do you know when you’ve hit your mid-life? What age does that happen? And do you need to change up your style and your beauty routine when you get there? Journalist and podcaster Kim France, creator of Girls of A Certain Age and co-host of the Everything is Fine podcast (and the founding editor of Lucky magazine) is here to discuss it all with us. We talk about those in-between ages that our culture and mainstream advertising tends to ignore—and why that is. Plus, we discuss sexuality after menopause; why beauty brands have a hard time talking to people in their 40s, 50s, and 60s; gray hair; whether “anti-aging” is a negative term; and so much more.

  • Shop the products mentioned on Ep. 409: shopmyshelf.us/collections/53044

item.title: Ep. 408: Jello Skin, Jess’s New Job & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 408: Jello Skin, Jess’s New Job & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
Do collagen supplements and drinks help you get bouncy, firm, “jello skin”? We’ve got the truth from a dermatologist—and some products and services that will give you a firm and bouncy “skin mattress.” Plus, Jess gives us details on her new job at Moda Operandi, and we talk about Emily Weiss stepping down as Glossier CEO, a new fragrance celebrating Queen Elizabeth’s Platinum Jubilee, a study showing how dolphins use coral to help heal their skin (!), and why baths need bubbles.

item.title: Ep. 407: What It’s Really Like to Paint a Celebrity Face with Daniel Kolaric
item.itunes:title: Ep. 407: What It’s Really Like to Paint a Celebrity Face with Daniel Kolaric
item.description:
Daniel Kolaric catapulted into the limelight after doing a gothic makeup look for Julia Fox that went viral. In this episode, the makeup artist and hairstylist tells us what it’s like to have one day’s work judged by millions of strangers, even though you’ve been a hairstylist and makeup artist for years. We also talk about where he finds his inspiration, the difference between editorial and red-carpet makeup, what it’s like being in Pat McGrath’s inner circle, how to adjust your makeup based on your eye shape, and some of Daniel’s favorite products. Plus, he shares behind-the-scenes details of that look Julia wore to Paris Fashion Week (Kanye West had nothing to do with it).

  • Shop the products mentioned on Ep. 407: shopmyshelf.us/collections/51978

item.title: Ep. 406: Makeup Trends, Nail Art & The Week’s Beauty News with Guest Co-Host Cat Quinn
item.itunes:title: Ep. 406: Makeup Trends, Nail Art & The Week’s Beauty News with Guest Co-Host Cat Quinn
item.description:
Cat Quinn, the executive director of global trend for MAC Cosmetics, predicts the next big things in beauty—and she's here to share them with the Fat Mascara Fam! Get ready to hear about: velvet lips, skater-boy blush, poplighting, corset nails, and jelly manicures. Plus, she and Jenn talk about a retail charter that aims to address racial bias in retail stores; why “reef-safe sunscreen” is a misnomer; Half Magic’s Magic Brownie; the Doré “French pharmacy” skincare line; how to stop biting your nails, stacked lashes, hairline-only keratin smoothing treatments, and so much more.

item.title: Ep. 405: How to Refresh Your Style with Chriselle Lim
item.itunes:title: Ep. 405: How to Refresh Your Style with Chriselle Lim
item.description:
Chriselle Lim is a fashion stylist, content creator, and entrepreneur—and she’s here to help us all get out of our collective post-pandemic fashion and beauty rut. She’s also the force behind spring’s blockbuster fragrance hit: Phlur Missing Person. We discuss how she became the owner and creative director of Phlur; the evolution of fashion and beauty content online; how her divorce inspired Missing Person (and caused her to change her own style); her best fashion and beauty tips; and products she’s obsessed with—including the $25 hot tool she uses to style her signature bob.

item.title: Ep. 404: Celebrity Plastic Surgery, Hair Discrimination & The Week’s Beauty News with Guest Co-Host Charisse Kenion
item.itunes:title: Ep. 404: Celebrity Plastic Surgery, Hair Discrimination & The Week’s Beauty News with Guest Co-Host Charisse Kenion
item.description:
Jenn and U.K.-based journalist and photographer Charisse Kenion, the host of BeautyMe podcast, discuss which celebrities have had work done (and whether it’s our business?), hair discrimination in the U.S. and U.K., and beauty news, including the shake-up at Too Faced, new “cosmetotextiles” with skincare infused into the fabric, and archaeological advancements that reveal what Cleopatra may have smelled like. Plus, Charisse shares a bit of her personal story and her favorite beauty products!

item.title: Ep. 403: All About Eyes with Dr. Nicky Shah
item.itunes:title: Ep. 403: All About Eyes with Dr. Nicky Shah
item.description:
Do lash serums really work? Are redness-relieving eye drops safe? It it okay to tightline? Opthamologist Nicky Shah, MD, cofounder of You & Eye by Dr. Nicky, is here to answer questions about sensitive eyes and explain the beauty and health effects of permanent makeup, fiber mascaras, glitter eyeshadow, and more. Plus, she wants us to care for a neglected part of our beauty routine: the meibomian glands.

item.title: Ep. 402: Anti-Aging Skincare for Beginners & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 402: Anti-Aging Skincare for Beginners & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
The world’s easiest guide to anti-aging skincare is here! We’ll tell you the one thing everyone should be doing to improve their skin (in a segment sponsored by No7 Beauty). Before that, Jess says goodbye to her job at Harper’s Bazaar, and we bring you the latest beauty headlines: big news for hair brands Crown Affair and Briogeo; the antioxidant benefits of Indian sandalwood; Alicia Keys’s new makeup line; and the return of Lolita Lempicka to the U.S. market. Plus, we’re still not over Kim Kardashian’s comments about losing weight to fit into her Met Gala dress. Let’s discuss.

item.title: Ep. 400: Conscious Consumption & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 400: Conscious Consumption & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
The production pace of the beauty and fashion industry is out of control, but what’s the solution? We talk about being more mindful with our fashion and beauty choices, and brands that encourage the same (see: KraveBeauty’s #SlowDownSkincare initiative). As journalists who report on a lot of these new products, we realize we’re part of the problem! But there’s room for nuance in this conversation, so let’s discuss. Also in this episode: Pat McGrath Labs Divine Skin Rose 001; Curlsmith’s acquisition (and the curly-hair soufflé everyone loves); Onda Beauty news; and the intriguing role a Milani concealer palette played in Johnny Depp’s defamation suit against Amber Heard.

item.description:
Erin Kleinberg, co-founder of branding agency Métier Creative and The Coveteur & founder of lifestyle brand Sidia, is here to help you upgrade your bathroom. We chat about product organization, the right towels, better lighting, and whether you should hide things in your medicine cabinet before guests come over. item.title: Ep. 398: HBO Max’s Not So Pretty, Double Standards in Sexual-Health Advertising & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 398: HBO Max’s Not So Pretty, Double Standards in Sexual-Health Advertising & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
Jenn reviews HBO Max’s docuseries Not So Pretty and has an eyebrow epiphany (thanks to Mikayla Nogueira and Mario Dedivanovic). We also talk about Glossier hiring Olivia Rodrigo as a spokesperson, sad sunscreen news, and the new fragrance collection from Off-White™. Plus: Why do Instagram and Facebook censor ads that mention—or even allude to the existence of—vulvas and vaginas? We discuss the double standard in sexual-health advertising.

item.title: Ep. 397: Beauty Tips for People with Cancer & Other Illnesses with Caitlin Kiernan
item.itunes:title: Ep. 397: Beauty Tips for People with Cancer & Other Illnesses with Caitlin Kiernan
item.description:
Learn how to prevent scars; manage chemotherapy-related hair loss; draw on missing eyebrows; treat dry skin and lips; deal with the side effects of radiation; and adjust your beauty routine during illness (the advice about fragranced products will surprise you!) during this incredibly helpful interview with beauty director Caitlin Kiernan, the author of Pretty Sick: The Beauty Guide for Women With Cancer. Caitlin is a breast cancer survivor and shares her story and what she learned—plus the products that helped her get through treatment and still help her today.

item.title: Ep. 395: How To Glow With Tanning Expert Jules Von Hepp (Replay)
item.itunes:title: Ep. 395: How To Glow With Tanning Expert Jules Von Hepp (Replay)
item.description:
Celebrity spray tan artist Jules Von Hep has seen hundreds of very famous people very naked, and his career has turned him into an advocate for body acceptance, mental-health awareness, and, of course, gorgeous skin! On today’s episode, the podcaster and founder of Isle of Paradise opens up about his path to self-acceptance, shares excellent advice for consuming social media in a way that’s productive and positive, and gives us his tips for getting an amazing fake tan, no matter your skin tone or body size. FYI: This episode features a new introduction, but the interview previously aired. We’ll be back next week with all new episodes!

item.title: Ep. 393: Collecting Vintage Makeup with Gabriela Hernandez
item.itunes:title: Ep. 393: Collecting Vintage Makeup with Gabriela Hernandez
item.description:
Gabriela Hernandez is a photographer, author, historian, and the founder of Bésame Cosmetics, a line inspired by her personal archive of vintage cosmetics. She shares how she started collecting makeup and the stories behind some of her favorite pieces; explains the history of mascara and how it got its name; tells us how color-changing lipsticks work; and explains how people have been beautifying themselves since the days of Ancient Egypt.

item.title: Ep. 391: How to Be a Smarter Foot Owner with Medical Pedicurist Marcela Correa
item.itunes:title: Ep. 391: How to Be a Smarter Foot Owner with Medical Pedicurist Marcela Correa
item.description:
You will never look at your feet the same way again after listening to our interview with medical pedicurist Marcela Correa, the owner of MediPedi NYC. You’ll learn why water is the enemy of a good pedicure; how to train your toenails to grow straighter; what it really takes to stop nail fungus; why exfoliating foot peels are problematic; the best (and worst) at-home pedicure tools; and how to shop for shoes that won’t hurt your feet. All that, plus Marcela is a blast to hang out with…enjoy!

item.title: Ep. 390: Recycling Empties, Tubing Mascaras & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 390: Recycling Empties, Tubing Mascaras & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
Jess is back in the studio, and we’re amazed to report that a celebrity beauty line did not launch this week. Instead, we’re talking about a new (and easy!) way to recycle your empty beauty products; progress with the CROWN Act that aims to end race-based hair discrimination in the U.S.; NFTs designed by makeup artist Alex Box; Clinique’s campaign featuring explorers and adventurers; and more. Plus, Jenn Raises a Wand to a new tubing mascara that’s different from the ones you already know and love.

item.title: Ep. 389: The Retinoid Roundtable (Live!) with Special Guests
item.itunes:title: Ep. 389: The Retinoid Roundtable (Live!) with Special Guests
item.description:
In honor of Retinoid Education Week, we hosted a live podcast with dermatologist Dr. Camille Howard-Verovic, Gloss Angeles co-host Sara Tan, and makeup artist Delina Medhin. In this special podcast, we discuss the acne-fighting power of retinoids, the multi-benefit retinoid ingredient adapalene, and tips for applying retinoids, coping with adult acne, adjusting your makeup application as your skin changes, and more. This episode is brought to you commercial free by Differin. Find Differin products at Differin.com or in the skincare aisles of U.S. stores like Walgreens, Target, CVS, and Walmart. item.title: Ep. 388: Mercury in Skin Whitening Creams & The Week’s Beauty News with Guest Co-Host Priya Rao Healy
item.itunes:title: Ep. 388: Mercury in Skin Whitening Creams & The Week’s Beauty News with Guest Co-Host Priya Rao Healy
item.description:
Priya Rao Healy, the executive editor of Glossy.co, joins Jenn to discuss the state of the skin-whitening market and a new report that finds high levels of mercury in products sold on eBay, Amazon, and Alibaba. Plus, they talk about Priya’s career, her favorite beauty products, the podcasts she hosts (Glossy Beauty Podcast and Unfair), and the news: Batman’s emo makeover; beauty trends at the Fall 2022 fashion shows in Paris; why qasil powder could be the next big thing in skincare; and new research showing that surgical masks make people look more attractive.

item.title: Ep. 384: DIY Eyebrow Tinting, Fish-Friendly Sunscreen & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 384: DIY Eyebrow Tinting, Fish-Friendly Sunscreen & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
You can dye your own eyebrows (Jenn tried it), and there’s a new (not FDA-approved, but very promising!) reef-friendly sunscreen ingredient debuting this spring. But the headline that really got us talking: Beauty brand Eos wants you to mail in your pubic hair to help the environment. Let’s discuss that, shall we? We’re also talking about price increases at e.l.f. Cosmetics, Jay-Z getting paid for an (unsuccessful) fragrance launch, and a liquid-gold moisturizer one of our listeners can’t live without.

item.title: Ep. 383: How the Scalp Actually Works with Dr. Caroline Robinson
item.itunes:title: Ep. 383: How the Scalp Actually Works with Dr. Caroline Robinson
item.description:
There’s been a lot of buzz lately about the “skinification” of hair and the importance of scalp health, so we asked dermatologist Caroline Robinson, MD, to help us sift through the chatter. She explains how hair follicles work, how to treat conditions like dandruff and seborrheic dermatitis, and shares the truth about controversial shampoo and styling ingredients such as sulfates, silicones, and castor oil. Plus, she answers one of our most popular listener questions: Why does my scalp hurt when my hair is dirty?

item.title: Ep. 382: French Authenticity, a Blue/Green Mystery & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 382: French Authenticity, a Blue/Green Mystery & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
Do you expect beauty products with French names to be made in France? What about L.A. Looks hair products: Are they created in California? A new lawsuit questions L’Oréal Paris’s provenance and makes us rethink a marketing tactic the beauty industry has relied on for years. Plus: John Paul Mitchell’s new spokesperson, the latest celebrity skincare line, a playlist that lets you experience fragrance through sound, and new research explaining why some languages use the same word for blue and green.

Do you expect beauty products with French names to be made in France? What about L.A. Looks hair products: Are they created in California? item.title: Ep. 381: Gwen Stefani Exclusive Interview
item.itunes:title: Ep. 381: Gwen Stefani Exclusive Interview
item.description:
Gwen Stefani reveals that having her family “torn apart” seven years ago led her on a new path and inspired her to create the makeup line, GXVE, which launches March 3. She tells us that her naivety in the ’90s helped her develop her music, and explains how her youth in Anaheim, California, inspired her style (and some of the looks she’s been criticized for); why she thinks there are a lot of women her age who feel ignored by the beauty industry; and why she still believes the magic’s in the makeup.

item.title: Ep. 380: Sulfates Are Back & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 380: Sulfates Are Back & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
The Ordinary goes pro-sulfate and we discuss: If sulfates aren’t that bad, why have so many companies removed them from their shampoos? Plus, New York Fashion Week beauty trends (are we really doing skinny brows again?); an interesting report from the American Academy of Facial Plastic and Reconstructive Surgery; Donni Davy’s Euphoria-inspired makeup line; perfumes that smell like french fries and Tim Tams; and Jenn tries to get Jess excited about fibroblasts in the Science Corner.

item.title: Ep. 379: Animal Dermatologist Dr. Joya Griffin Has All the Answers
item.itunes:title: Ep. 379: Animal Dermatologist Dr. Joya Griffin Has All the Answers
item.description:
Do scented candles bother dogs? Are essential oils dangerous for cats? And what should you do if your pet has skin, hair, or nail problems? Veterinarian dermatologist Dr. Joya Griffin, the star of National Geographic’s Pop Goes The Vet, tells us what it’s like to treat the skin, hair, and nails of polar bears, pigs, pocket pets, and more. Plus, we talk about Jenn’s hairless dog, Jess’s longhaired cat, some of the medical mysteries Dr. Griffin has solved—and what she really thinks when she sees pets with manicures and dye jobs.

item.title: Ep. 375: Boy Smells' Matthew Herman is Breaking the Fragrance Binary
item.itunes:title: Ep. 375: Boy Smells' Matthew Herman is Breaking the Fragrance Binary
item.description:
Matthew Herman talks with Jess about what inspired him and co-founder David Kien to create Boy Smells, a buzzy brand that makes "genderful" candles, perfumes, and underwear. Matthew, a former fashion designer for brands like Proenza Schouler and Nasty Gal, shares the story of his fragrance company’s mega-rise during the pandemic, tells us about the time collaborator Kacey Musgraves popped up in his DMs, and explains why beauty is embracing gender inclusivity better than the fashion industry.

item.title: Ep. 374: The Legacy of Angel Perfume & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 374: The Legacy of Angel Perfume & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
We share the story behind Angel perfume and discuss the influence it still has on today’s fragrances, in memory of Thierry Mugler. Before that: Emma Thompson on nudity in her 60s and plastic surgery; Julia Fox’s eyeliner; Tessa Thompson's Armani campaign; schmancy household cleaners from Courtney Cox; and why we’re all worried about body odor and bad breath. Plus, a listener shares the vitamin C serum that’s actually a joy to use, and we raise a wand to a purse-worthy vegan hand cream and a hair oil that makes Jenn feel like an Olsen sister.

item.title: Ep. 372: Varicose Vein Treatment, Desk Lipsticks & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 372: Varicose Vein Treatment, Desk Lipsticks & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
How do you fix varicose veins on your legs? Jess shares her experience getting endovenous laser therapy (EVLT) and a microphlebectomy, and explains why varicose veins are different than spider veins, the symptoms, treatments (some may be covered by medical insurance), and what healing has been like for her. (Warning: She explains the details of her procedure, so you may want to skip that part if you’re squeamish.) Before that, we discuss price increases at The Ordinary; Goop’s Hands Off My Vagina candle; Rebundle’s sustainable, plant-based hair extensions; and asbestos contamination in talc-based products. Plus, which lipsticks are worthy of the title “desk lipstick”?

item.title: Ep. 371: How Makeup Changed the Face of American History with Ilise S. Carter
item.itunes:title: Ep. 371: How Makeup Changed the Face of American History with Ilise S. Carter
item.description:
Author (and sideshow performer!) Ilise S. Cater shares the fascinating history of makeup in the U.S.A., from Martha Washington’s multipurpose rouge made with whale earwax to the “Because You’re Worth It” era of the 1970s, when “makeup learned to talk feminism.” Along the way, we’ll meet the first celebrity influencer, find out if the suffragettes actually wore red lipstick, learn how Hollywood—and film itself—influenced the beauty landscape, and hear the rags-to-riches tales of some of America’s pioneering beauty entrepreneurs.

  • Ilise S. Carter's book: The Red Menace: How Lipstick Changed the Face of American History

item.itunes:title: Ep. 370: Dyeing Your Hairline, Makeup for Accutane Side Effects & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
Jenn had an at-home hair color breakthrough, Jess talked to Cher (!), and there's so much more to chat about, including industry news, Kate Hudson’s foray into skincare, and Neen, a subscription-model makeup line from Jeanine Lobell, the founder of Stila. Plus, we Raise A Wand to a foundation that covers the flaky side effects of Accutane (isotretinoin), the German pharmacy foot cream that heals super-dry feet, and the only moisturizer that works when your rosacea is flaring and even water stings.

item.title: Ep. 369: How Josie Maran Became Beauty’s “Rebel-Rascal” CEO
item.itunes:title: Ep. 369: How Josie Maran Became Beauty’s “Rebel-Rascal” CEO
item.description:
Josie Maran is the only CEO we know who rode a horse bareback (while naked) for work, started a band with Nicole Richie, starred in a vampire movie, and created a multimillion-dollar beauty business after a chance encounter with a dewy-skinned septuagenarian in Saint-Tropez. She’s here to share those stories and more, including how she cured her stepdaughter’s eczema without pharmaceuticals and why she appointed her mom Chief Aesthetic Officer of her company (cheesecake may have something to do with it).

item.title: Ep. 368: New Beauty Tech, Skin-Cell Bandages & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 368: New Beauty Tech, Skin-Cell Bandages & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
Welcome to the future! We’re talking about the most promising beauty finds at the Consumer Electronics Show, including a gadget to make at-home hair coloring easier, a smart fragrance device that packs 100 possible perfumes into one bottle, and a toothbrush with a camera (do we really need that?). Plus, there’s lots of news to catch up on, including a law that requires Tennessee salon workers to get domestic violence training; Chanel's new (more sustainable) beauty line; and, in Jenn's Science Corner, astronauts making bandages out of their own skin cells.

item.title: Ep. 367: Retinoids, Peptides, Acids, and Antioxidants with Dr. Dendy Engelman (Replay)
item.itunes:title: Ep. 367: Retinoids, Peptides, Acids, and Antioxidants with Dr. Dendy Engelman (Replay)
item.description:
Dermatological surgeon Dr. Dendy Engelman is here to demystify topical anti-agers and explain how retinoids, peptides, antioxidants, and acids work. Plus, she offers real talk on which ingredients are truly, scientifically harmful and which are simply vilified by the interwebs. This episode features a new introduction but the interview originally aired in 2018. We’ll be back January 11 with all new episodes!

item.title: Ep. 364: DiamondGlow Facials, Emily in Paris & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 364: DiamondGlow Facials, Emily in Paris & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
We’re winding down the year with glowy skin, an Emily in Paris watch party, and a lively week in the beauty world! In the news: beauty takes on And Just Like That (the Sex and the City reboot); Elon Musk’s new haircut; money pieces, the not-so-new hair color trend; camels getting Botox; and new research showing pollution tans your skin just like the sun. Plus, Jenn reviews the DiamonGlow facial and we invite you to join us for an Emily in Paris watch party on Thursday, Dec. 23, at 10 PM EST, the day after the Season 2 premiere.

item.title: Ep. 363: A Perfumer’s Journey with Rodrigo Flores-Roux
item.itunes:title: Ep. 363: A Perfumer’s Journey with Rodrigo Flores-Roux
item.description:
Born in Mexico City to a family of aesthetes, Rodrigo Flores-Roux was destined to be a perfumer. He reminisces about his fragrance-loving grandmothers, his training in Versailles, and the more than 500 perfumes he’s created—including Clinique Happy and Arquiste Misfit, the Fragrance Foundation’s 2021 Indie Fragrance of the Year. Plus, we talk about the future of perfumery and how he and his colleagues at Givaudan, in New York City, are developing new aroma ingredients using upcycling techniques.

item.title: Ep. 362: Beauty, Pop Culture & Politics with Co-Host Darian Symoné Harvin
item.itunes:title: Ep. 362: Beauty, Pop Culture & Politics with Co-Host Darian Symoné Harvin
item.description:
Journalist Darian Symoné Harvin is Jenn’s guest co-host this week! She shares her beauty philosophy and her analysis of the week’s beauty news: Lush stops advertising on Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, and TikTok, citing mental-health concerns; a California man files the first lawsuit based on the CROWN Act; Chrissy Teigen gets eyebrow transplants; bed bugs (!) invade the Science Corner; and more. Plus, Jenn & Darian discuss whether posthumous makeup collaborations are disrespectful and Raise A Wand to an at-home DIY nail system, a gorgeous cleansing oil, and a quick-absorbing hand cream.

item.title: Ep. 361: Smells Like Fun with Perfume Room’s Emma Vernon
item.itunes:title: Ep. 361: Smells Like Fun with Perfume Room’s Emma Vernon
item.description:
Comedian Emma Vernon, host of Perfume Room and one of our favorite #perfumetok follows (@emma_vern), shares stories inspired by her scent collection, including her adventures as a late bloomer in love and the seductive perfume that changed it all. We also talk about high-low fragrance dupes; the reason big, white florals don’t belong on tweens; and the $7 scent she’s currently obsessed with. Plus, we'll be hanging with Emma on her podcast, Perfume Room (@perfumeroompod) next week—follow her so you don’t miss the episode!

item.title: Ep 360: The Evolution of Press-On Nails & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep 360: The Evolution of Press-On Nails & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
Artificial nails have come a long way, from the late Middle Ages (their first appearance) to the Lee Press On Nails of the 1980s. We share their history, then celebrate the current revival and tell you about some of the best press-on nails we’ve tried. Before that, lots of news to discuss, including the Machine Gun Kelly PR blitz for his new nail polish line; big changes at Proactiv; Galderma’s purchase of Alastin; a new beauty column from Linda Wells; and details on a fascinating exhibit of Agarwood Oud at Mandy Aftel’s Archive of Curious Scents.

item.title: Ep. 359: The Best Bargain Beauty Products (Replay)
item.itunes:title: Ep. 359: The Best Bargain Beauty Products (Replay)
item.description:
We went back through all our interviews, called up some of our favorite former guests, and compiled a list of the absolute best bargain beauty buys. We’re sharing the must-have mascaras, hair masks, sunscreens, body lotions, and more from makeup artists like Mario Dedivanovic and Daniel Martin, hair stylists Ashley Streicher, Harry Josh, and Sally Hershberger—and tons of other makeup artists, hair stylists, dermatologists, influencers, and celebrities. Best of all, everything is under $15! This episode features a new introduction, but most of the content was originally featured on an episode that aired in April, 2020. We'll be back next week with all new episodes!

item.title: Ep. 358: Busting Beauty Stereotypes with Hairstylist David Lopez (Replay)
item.itunes:title: Ep. 358: Busting Beauty Stereotypes with Hairstylist David Lopez (Replay)
item.description:
Why do hair brands sell different products to men and women? How can we make the beauty world less intimidating? And why is everyone so scared of styling mousse? Hairstylist David Lopez has answers to those questions and more. Plus, he shares his technique for creating effortless waves on (almost) any hair texture, the best concealer for men and makeup novices, and behind-the-scenes secrets from the Queer Eye casting process. This episode features a new introduction, but the interview previously aired in October, 2020. We’ll be back next week with all new episodes!

item.title: Ep. 357: The Surprising Side Effects of Beauty Products with Dr. Iris Rubin
item.itunes:title: Ep. 357: The Surprising Side Effects of Beauty Products with Dr. Iris Rubin
item.description:
Dermatologist Iris Rubin, MD, realized hair products were causing her acne, so she created Seen, a line of skin-caring haircare. We discuss that and so much more: her career as a pediatric laser surgeon, whether silicone’s bad reputation is deserved, and how common household and personal care products can cause things like migraines, rashes, and more.

item.title: Ep. 356: What LED Light Is Really Doing to Your Skin & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 356: What LED Light Is Really Doing to Your Skin & The Week’s Beauty News
item.description:
There are lots of at-home light therapy gadgets that claim to benefit your skin, but they also raise questions: If red LED light boosts hair growth, what happens when you use it on your face? And if blue light may be problematic when it comes from screens, why are blue LED lights used to treat acne? We’re getting to the bottom of things, with help from dermatologist Blair Murphy-Rose, MD. Plus, Jenn tested the Solawave skincare wand with red light therapy and shares her review. Before that, we’ve got lots of beauty news and our favorite skin, hair, and makeup bargains from all the holiday sales.

item.title: Ep. 355: Oils, Extracts, and More with Beauty Botanist Jennifer Hirsch
item.itunes:title: Ep. 355: Oils, Extracts, and More with Beauty Botanist Jennifer Hirsch
item.description:
What makes aloe soothing? How does kigelia extract firm skin? Jennifer Hirsch, a botanist who trained at the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew, has studied ethnobotany and worked with NGOs to research botanical business diversification for communities around the world. Now, she helps beauty brands bring the power of plants to their products. In this episode, she shares stories from her travels and explains how botanicals like ashwagandha, argan, and cucumber can improve skin and hair—and which herbal supplements have side effects to watch out for.

item.title: Ep. 354: “Science-Backed” Perfume, a $7 Cry-Proof Mascara & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 354: “Science-Backed” Perfume, a $7 Cry-Proof Mascara & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:subtitle: Jess tells us what Fraxel is really like, and then we chat about the heat-sensitive bottles in Addison Rae’s “science-backed” perfume line; whether makeup value sets are worth their listed prices; the MAC collection from Blackpink’s Lisa; the conclusio...
item.description:
Jess tells us what Fraxel is really like, and then we chat about the heat-sensitive bottles in Addison Rae’s “science-backed” perfume line; whether makeup value sets are worth their listed prices; the MAC collection from Blackpink’s Lisa; the conclusion of Jay Z’s perfume legal battle; a health warning about biotin supplements; and new scientific research based on Cardi B’s belief that a thottie “never gets cold.” Plus, Jenn & Jess Raise a Wand to their (current) favorite skin-musk scents and we send a big Fat Mascara Family hug to listener Anna, who tells us about the $7 mascara that holds up to her tears.

item.itunes:subtitle: Hairstylist Mara Roszak booked her first celebrity client when she was just 17 (her mom had to drive her to the job!), and she’s been working steadily ever since, with clients like Emma Stone, Zoe Saldana, Natalie Portman, and Cara Delevingne. In this ...
item.description:
Hairstylist Mara Roszak booked her first celebrity client when she was just 17 (her mom had to drive her to the job!), and she’s been working steadily ever since, with clients like Emma Stone, Zoe Saldana, Natalie Portman, and Cara Delevingne. In this interview, she shares how she got her start, anecdotes from the set, the story behind her line, Rōz, and the products she stocks in her kit—and at her salon, Mare.

item.title: Ep. 351: What Does the Porn Industry Have to Do with Beauty?
item.itunes:title: Ep. 351: What Does the Porn Industry Have to Do with Beauty?
item.itunes:subtitle: Pornography has everything to do with sex, but it doesn’t necessarily reflect what people find attractive, says Cindy Gallop, ad executive, brand leader, entrepreneur, and founder of social sextech platform MakeLoveNotPorn. In this conversation, she ta...
item.description:
Pornography has everything to do with sex, but it doesn’t necessarily reflect what people find attractive, says Cindy Gallop, ad executive, brand leader, entrepreneur, and founder of social sextech platform MakeLoveNotPorn. In this conversation, she talks to Jess about the false expectations the adult-film industry has set up in terms of body image; the homogeneous, often surgically altered, look of the actors in mainstream porn; how the beauty industry has flirted with the language of porn; the rise of genital plastic surgery; and so much more.

item.title: Ep. 350: Acne Scars, A Blue Light Controversy & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 350: Acne Scars, A Blue Light Controversy & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:subtitle: If your skin texture is uneven because of acne scars, we can help! Two dermatologists offer their tips and advice—including some things you can do at home. Plus, we’re talking about skincare designed to help with blue light damage: Do you really need i...
item.description:
If your skin texture is uneven because of acne scars, we can help! Two dermatologists offer their tips and advice—including some things you can do at home. Plus, we’re talking about skincare designed to help with blue light damage: Do you really need it? Streamer and YouTube creator Rachell “Valkyrae” Hofstetter’s fans certainly don’t think so. And there’s lots of other news to discuss: a nail-painting robot, Prada’s virtual fragrance model, a Davines campaign to help remove ocean plastic, career advice from Dermalogica’s founder, and more.

item.title: Ep. 349: What SuChin Pak and Kulap Vilaysack Add to Their Carts
item.itunes:title: Ep. 349: What SuChin Pak and Kulap Vilaysack Add to Their Carts
item.itunes:subtitle: What we buy reveals a lot about who we are, says comedian-writer-director Kulap Vilaysack and journalist SuChin Pak, the hosts of the Add to Cart podcast. They talk to Jenn about double-cleansing, the environmental impact (and guilt) of consumerism, wh...
item.description:
What we buy reveals a lot about who we are, says comedian-writer-director Kulap Vilaysack and journalist SuChin Pak, the hosts of the Add to Cart podcast. They talk to Jenn about double-cleansing, the environmental impact (and guilt) of consumerism, why SuChin still has makeup from her MTV days, and what Kulap uses to get skin like a “damp mochi ball.” Plus, Ku shares the reason she decided to grow out her gray hair and Su explains why she bought 18 types of sleeping pills on a recent trip to France.

item.title: Ep. 348: Eyeliner That Won’t Smudge, Benzene Recalls & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 348: Eyeliner That Won’t Smudge, Benzene Recalls & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:subtitle: We’ve got a makeup-artist-approved list of the best eyeliners that won’t smudge, smear, transfer, travel, change color, or make you look like a raccoon by lunchtime—along with tips for extra liner longevity from makeup artist Sarah Uslan. Before that, ...
item.description:
We’ve got a makeup-artist-approved list of the best eyeliners that won’t smudge, smear, transfer, travel, change color, or make you look like a raccoon by lunchtime—along with tips for extra liner longevity from makeup artist Sarah Uslan. Before that, lots of beauty news to chat about: Another benzene recall (and a reminder of what benzene is and why it keeps popping up in personal care products); combs made of neem wood and the new Augustinus Bader hair line; why Jay-Z is going to court for a perfume lawsuit; research on how our brains process stinky scents, and more.

item.description:
We discuss rusty social skills and how to comment (or not?) on someone’s appearance. Plus, Jenn made a DIY linen spray, we have three “Raise A Wand” suggestions for sensitive skin, and there’s lots of news to chat about: the future of fragrance at Parfums Christian Dior and Estée Lauder Companies; Tula Skincare’s beautiful PSA-style campaign; and changes to California’s training requirements for cosmetologists, hair stylists, and barbers.

item.title: Ep. 345: Dr. Harvey Karp Has Good Advice for Tired and Overwhelmed Parents
item.itunes:title: Ep. 345: Dr. Harvey Karp Has Good Advice for Tired and Overwhelmed Parents
item.itunes:subtitle: Harvey Karp, MD, is a rock star pediatrician and child-development expert. In this episode, Jess interviews Dr. Karp, the CEO of the smart-tech company Happiest Baby and the creator of the Snoo, a crib designed to keep babies safe and help parents and ...
item.description:
Harvey Karp, MD, is a rock star pediatrician and child-development expert. In this episode, Jess interviews Dr. Karp, the CEO of the smart-tech company Happiest Baby and the creator of the Snoo, a crib designed to keep babies safe and help parents and infants get more sleep. They have a frank conversation about parenting and the exhaustion that comes with it, how today's social structure and the loss of “the village” has changed the way we raise children, postpartum depression, self care, and how new parents can build confidence in their parenting skills. -- Links and sponsors: fatmascara.com/blog; Shop the products mentioned on this episode: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara Raising a Wand; Social media: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation and be featured on the show: email info@fatmascara.com or leave a voicemail at +1 646-481-8182.

item.description:
How do you get a brighter smile if you have really sensitive teeth? We share answers from dentist Lisa Creaven and tell you which tooth-whitening products won’t leave you drooling everywhere in pain. Before that, let’s dig into the beauty news: Ellen DeGeneres’ skincare line; Goop’s supplement to “support women’s sexual desire”; By Kilian’s perfume collab with French Montana; the perfect candle for tailgating; and, in Jess’s Animal House, details on two cruelty-free beauty companies that came together to save rabbits from animal testing. -- Links and sponsors: fatmascara.com/blog; Shop the products mentioned on this episode: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara Raising a Wand; Social media: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation and be featured on the show: email info@fatmascara.com or leave a voicemail at +1 646-481-8182.

item.itunes:title: Ep. 343: How to Be a Beauty Flexitarian with Jessica Richards
item.itunes:subtitle: Boutique owner Jessica Richards shares her strategy for discovering the new beauty products you won’t be able to live without. Some are “clean,” some are traditional, and many are sustainable, but they’re all must-haves, like the natural bug spray that...
item.description:
Boutique owner Jessica Richards shares her strategy for discovering the new beauty products you won’t be able to live without. Some are “clean,” some are traditional, and many are sustainable, but they’re all must-haves, like the natural bug spray that actually works, the revolutionary hairbrush designed for post-chemo patients, and the women’s “pleasure serum” that she can’t keep in stock at her shop, Shen Beauty. Plus, Jessica discusses the retail trends shaping the beauty industry and offers excellent advice for small-business owners, entrepreneurs, and anyone thinking of starting their own wellness, sexual health, cosmetics, hair, or skincare line. -- Links and sponsors: fatmascara.com/blog; Shop the products mentioned on this episode: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara Raising a Wand; Social media: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation and be featured on the show: email info@fatmascara.com or leave a voicemail at +1 646-481-8182.

item.itunes:title: Ep. 342: Buccal Fat Removal, CoolSculpting, Aesthetic Choices & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:subtitle: Like it or not, when celebrities talk about getting cosmetic procedures, they get attention. This week, we discuss the impulse to judge (and danger of judging!) others’ aesthetic choices, and share straightforward information on two procedures that hav...
item.description:
Like it or not, when celebrities talk about getting cosmetic procedures, they get attention. This week, we discuss the impulse to judge (and danger of judging!) others’ aesthetic choices, and share straightforward information on two procedures that have been in the spotlight: buccal fat removal and CoolSculpting. Plus, Doja Cat’s entrée into beauty; perfumes inspired by video games; a Sour Patch Kids makeup-setting spray (?!); TLC’s medical dermatology show Dr. Mercy; and the surprising evolutionary advantage of having a beard. -- For links and sponsors mentioned in this episode: fatmascara.com/blog; To shop the products: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: +1 646-481-8182.

item.description:
Are you showering too often? We asked two dermatologists to weigh in on the cultural trend of bathing less frequently and to share some strategies for washing without disrupting our microbiomes. Before that, lots of news to discuss: why Chanel is buying up jasmine fields in France; poet Amanda Gorman’s new role with Estée Lauder; the return of Fashion Fair; Miley Cyrus’s campaign for customizable skincare brand Hers; “euphoric” functional beverages; and, in Jess’s Animal House, some excellent news from Charlotte Tilbury. - For links and sponsors mentioned in this episode: fatmascara.com/blog; To shop the products: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: +1 646-481-8182.

item.title: Ep. 332: The Surprising Side Benefits of Cosmetic Injectables & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 332: The Surprising Side Benefits of Cosmetic Injectables & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:subtitle: Hyaluronic acid fillers (such as Juvéderm) and neuromodulators (such as Botox) have some surprising benefits—other than the usual stuff like a plumper complexion and fewer wrinkles. Jenn just got injected and she’ll tell you all about it, including the...
item.description:
Hyaluronic acid fillers (such as Juvéderm) and neuromodulators (such as Botox) have some surprising benefits—other than the usual stuff like a plumper complexion and fewer wrinkles. Jenn just got injected and she’ll tell you all about it, including the explanation her dermatologist gave for the unexpected improvements. We’re also talking about the viral video that proves how well a Peter Thomas Roth eye cream works on under-eye bags and other news: a $45 nail polish; corporate updates at Shiseido Americas and Olaplex; Ariana Grande’s new beauty line; and, in the Science Corner, research showing that odors and fragrances are actually encoded in language (you just have to know how to listen for the clues). -- For links and sponsors mentioned in this episode: fatmascara.com/blog; To shop the products: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: +1 646-481-8182. 

Become a member at https://plus.acast.com/s/fatmascara.

item.title: Ep. 330: How to Glow with Tanning Expert Jules Von Hep
item.itunes:title: Ep. 330: How to Glow with Tanning Expert Jules Von Hep
item.itunes:subtitle: Celebrity spray tan artist Jules Von Hep has seen hundreds of very famous people very naked, and his career has turned him into an advocate for body acceptance, mental-health awareness, and, of course, gorgeous skin! On today’s episode, the podcaster a...
item.description:
Celebrity spray tan artist Jules Von Hep has seen hundreds of very famous people very naked, and his career has turned him into an advocate for body acceptance, mental-health awareness, and, of course, gorgeous skin! On today’s episode, the podcaster and founder of Isle of Paradise opens up about his path to self-acceptance, shares excellent advice for consuming social media in a way that’s productive and positive, and gives us his tips for getting an amazing fake tan, no matter your skin tone or body size. -- For links and sponsors mentioned in this episode: fatmascara.com/blog; To shop the products: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: +1 646-481-8182.

item.title: Ep. 329: What Real Inclusivity Looks Like with Sharon Chuter
item.itunes:title: Ep. 329: What Real Inclusivity Looks Like with Sharon Chuter
item.itunes:subtitle: Uoma Beauty’s self-proclaimed “weirdo in chief” is here to inspire! She shares the rebellious path she took from teenage beauty entrepreneur in Nigeria to head of her own company, and opens up about the difficulties she faced as a Black woman in the co...
item.description:
Uoma Beauty’s self-proclaimed “weirdo in chief” is here to inspire! She shares the rebellious path she took from teenage beauty entrepreneur in Nigeria to head of her own company, and opens up about the difficulties she faced as a Black woman in the corporate world and why she’s doing things differently now that she’s in charge. Plus, Sharon offers her honest take on the beauty industry’s efforts to become more diverse and inclusive over the past 15 months and explains why she'll continue to fight for economic opportunities for Black communities. -- For links and sponsors mentioned in this episode: fatmascara.com/blog; To shop the products: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: +1 646-481-8182.

item.description:

We explain how the skincare ingredients retinal, retinol, and retinyl palmitate work; the difference between them; and why product formulation matters (in a segment sponsored by StriVectin). item.itunes:subtitle: Should you get cosmetic injectables such as Botox or dermal filler? Are at-home skin-devices worth the money? Is it ever okay to pop a pimple? Skincare expert Renée Rouleau answers all those questions and more. We discuss what facials can and can’t do ...
item.description:
Should you get cosmetic injectables such as Botox or dermal filler? Are at-home skin-devices worth the money? Is it ever okay to pop a pimple? Skincare expert Renée Rouleau answers all those questions and more. We discuss what facials can and can’t do for your complexion, how to find an aesthetician you trust, and which products all her facialist friends swear by. This episode features a new introduction, but the interview previously aired in October, 2019. item.title: Ep. 325: How to Succeed in Fashion with Hairstylist Jimmy Paul
item.itunes:title: Ep. 325: How to Succeed in Fashion with Hairstylist Jimmy Paul
item.itunes:subtitle: Hairstylist Jimmy Paul takes us on a journey, starting in the small steel mill town outside of Pittsburgh where he dreamed big and landing in New York City, where he made his name as one of the fashion industry’s most in-demand talents. His tale is a t...
item.description:
Hairstylist Jimmy Paul takes us on a journey, starting in the small steel mill town outside of Pittsburgh where he dreamed big and landing in New York City, where he made his name as one of the fashion industry’s most in-demand talents. His tale is a true New York story: He talks about his time at the The Pyramid Club, with nightlife legends like Ethyl Eichelberger, Agosto Machado, and Lady Bunny; getting his start at Oribe; Marc Jacobs’ legendary 1992 grunge collection for Perry Ellis; his first Vogue cover; collaborating with photographers like Steven Meisel, David LaChapelle, and Joshua Jordan; and so much more. Also, Jimmy shares what it takes to weather the ups and downs, keep the creative spark alive, and stay focused on the work. -- For links and sponsors mentioned in this episode: fatmascara.com/blog; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: +1 646-481-8182. 

Become a member at https://plus.acast.com/s/fatmascara.

Also, Jimmy shares what it takes to weather the ups and downs, keep the creative spark alive, and stay focused on the work. -- For links and sponsors mentioned in this episode: fatmascara.com/blog; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: +1 646-481-8182.

item.title: Ep. 323: The Ethics of Beauty with Philosopher Heather Widdows
item.itunes:title: Ep. 323: The Ethics of Beauty with Philosopher Heather Widdows
item.itunes:subtitle: Why has beauty become so important to our society? Is looks-based discrimination, or lookism, as bad as sexism or racism? Why do beauty and wellness companies use moral language (“Be your best self!”) to sell products? These are just a few of the big q...
item.description:
Why has beauty become so important to our society? Is looks-based discrimination, or lookism, as bad as sexism or racism? Why do beauty and wellness companies use moral language (“Be your best self!”) to sell products? These are just a few of the big questions that Heather Widdows, PhD, a professor of philosophy at the University of Birmingham, answers in this fascinating interview that will make you rethink the way you talk about (and judge) other people's looks and reconsider how you respond when others comment on your appearance. -- For links and sponsors mentioned in this episode: fatmascara.com/blog; To shop the products: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: +1 646-481-8182.

item.itunes:title: Ep. 318: The Wolf Cut & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:subtitle: We take a closer look at the haircut that’s everywhere this summer and chat about its origins, what makes a haircut go viral, and whether or not it’s safe to call the wolf cut “Gen Z’s answer to the mullet.” Before that, there’s lots of beauty news to ...
item.description:
We take a closer look at the haircut that’s everywhere this summer and chat about its origins, what makes a haircut go viral, and whether or not it’s safe to call the wolf cut “Gen Z’s answer to the mullet.” Before that, there’s lots of beauty news to discuss: details on the new Glossier retail locations; the temporary shutdown of KKW Beauty; Tracee Ellis Ross’s docuseries, The Hair Tales; NYC Cosmetics sponsoring e-gamers; and more. Plus: A new study shows how quickly hair can go gray due to stress and why the process may be reversible, and a listener shares her favorite “summer” moisturizer. -- For links, products, and sponsors mentioned in this episode: fatmascara.com/blog;To shop the products: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: 646-481-8182.

item.itunes:title: Ep. 316: The Truth About Sun-Protective Clothing & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:subtitle: What is UPF clothing and how does it actually protect you from UV rays? So glad you asked! We explain the technology, tell you about some of our favorite brands, and share an easy hack for making your own sun-protective clothing at home. We also chat a...
item.description:
What is UPF clothing and how does it actually protect you from UV rays? So glad you asked! We explain the technology, tell you about some of our favorite brands, and share an easy hack for making your own sun-protective clothing at home. We also chat about #cryptocosmetics from e.l.f. Cosmetics; sunscreen-scented dog-poop bags (?!); a Lisa Frank lawsuit; the Environmental Working Group's product-labeling initiative; Scarlett Johansson's beauty line; and animal-friendly news at major fashion labels, including Canada Goose. item.description:
Professor Lauren Labrecque, PhD, researches how color influences the decisions we make and the culture around us. In this interview, she takes a closer look at the logos and packaging from some of our favorite beauty brands to explain how they influence our purchasing behavior. item.title: Ep. 314: Armpit Detox, PFAs in Cosmetics & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 314: Armpit Detox, PFAs in Cosmetics & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:subtitle: Do your underarms need a deep cleaning? We take a closer look at armpit detox products to see A) how they work and B) if they’re necessary. Plus, in Jenn’s Science Corner, we dig into new research that found PFAs (perfluoroalkyl and polyfluoroalkyl sub...
item.description:
Do your underarms need a deep cleaning? We take a closer look at armpit detox products to see A) how they work and B) if they’re necessary. Plus, in Jenn’s Science Corner, we dig into new research that found PFAs (perfluoroalkyl and polyfluoroalkyl substances that are often referred to as “forever chemicals”) in cosmetics sold in North America and discuss how prevalent the chemicals are, their potential dangers, legislation that could address the issue, and what it means for you. Plus: the elf ear cosmetic surgery trend in China, a new perfume museum, a novel way to make salons healthier, and more. -- Become a Fat Mascara+ member to listen to the podcast without ads: fatmascara.com/member; Episode recap & list of products featured: fatmascara.com/blog; To shop the products: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara / Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: +1 646-481-8182.
