item.title: Ep. 313: Cindy Crawford Opens Up About Aging, The Supermodel Era, and More
item.itunes:title: Ep. 313: Cindy Crawford Opens Up About Aging, The Supermodel Era, and More
item.itunes:subtitle: Model Cindy Crawford is refreshingly honest about her “age maintenance” and what it’s like to model at 55 during this wide-ranging interview. She shares stories from the set of MTV’s House of Style, explains why she’ll never be able to do makeup as wel...
item.description:
Model Cindy Crawford is refreshingly honest about her “age maintenance” and what it’s like to model at 55 during this wide-ranging interview. She shares stories from the set of MTV’s House of Style, explains why she’ll never be able to do makeup as well as Naomi Campbell, and reveals what she said to her daughter, Kaia Gerber, before they walked the Versace runway together. Plus: the real reason she started Meaningful Beauty (her skincare brand, which just expanded with a new haircare range), the makeup products she can’t live without, why she wears bespoke perfume, and the reason she puts lemon on her sushi. -- Become a Fat Mascara+ member to listen to the podcast without ads: fatmascara.com/member; Episode recap & list of products featured: fatmascara.com/blog; To shop the products: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara / Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: +1 646-481-8182.

item.title: Special Ep. 311: Answering Acne Questions and Busting Myths with Dr. Chris Tomassian, Powered by The INKEY List
item.itunes:title: Special Ep. 311: Answering Acne Questions and Busting Myths with Dr. Chris Tomassian, Powered by The INKEY List
item.itunes:subtitle: In honor of Acne Awareness Month, we asked dermatologist Dr. Chris Tomassian (who has more than a million followers on TikTok) to answer your acne questions. In this special episode, powered by The INKEY List, we discuss acne...
item.description:
In honor of Acne Awareness Month, we asked dermatologist Dr. Chris Tomassian (who has more than a million followers on TikTok) to answer your acne questions. In this special episode, powered by The INKEY List, we discuss acne types and causes, reveal which foods can make your skin worse, teach you how to tell if your acne is hormonal, and more. Plus, Dr. Tomassian explains the ingredients you can use to help treat pimples, blackheads, and even cystic acne at home. For a list of products featured in this episode, visit fatmascara.com/blog. -- This episode is brought to by The INKEY List, a skincare brand that believes knowledge powers change. If you have a question about your skin or skincare, you can #askINKEY any time! They have dedicated skincare coaches available to answer all your questions 24/7 via live chat on their website (theinkeylist.com) or via social (direct message @theinkeylist).

Become a member at https://plus.acast.com/s/fatmascara.

item.itunes:subtitle: If you want to remove peach fuzz and unwanted facial hair while gently exfoliating your skin, shaving just might be the answer. Jenn, a longtime face shaver, shares her experience with DIY dermaplaning and offers tips from her dermatologist, Dr. Heidi ...
item.description:
If you want to remove peach fuzz and unwanted facial hair while gently exfoliating your skin, shaving just might be the answer. Jenn, a longtime face shaver, shares her experience with DIY dermaplaning and offers tips from her dermatologist, Dr. Heidi Waldorf, then she and Jess reveal the best face shavers for women. Before that, get up to speed on the latest in beauty: a review of Huda Beauty's new line, GloWish; skincare by Hyram Yarbo; Harry Styles' beauty line; Ulta’s 15% Pledge; a new color director at Clé de Peau Beauté; and TRESemmé’s PETA-friendly news. -- Episode recap & list of products featured: fatmascara.com/blog; To shop the products: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara / Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: +1 646-481-8182.

item.itunes:subtitle: Video-conferencing can affect the way you feel about your face. In this episode, we discuss how screen time distorts your perception of your looks and share a dermatologist’s tips for making your next Zoom/FaceTime/Google Hangout more positive. There’s...
item.description:
Video-conferencing can affect the way you feel about your face. In this episode, we discuss how screen time distorts your perception of your looks and share a dermatologist’s tips for making your next Zoom/FaceTime/Google Hangout more positive. There’s also lots of beauty news to get into: a new deodorant for people with visual impairment and motor disabilities; the Urban Decay X Prince makeup collection; Vita Coco’s hair-care range; and more. Plus, in Jenn's Science Corner, we’re going deep on new research that investigates why (and how) some women are embracing their gray hair despite the stigma against it. -- For a list of products featured in this episode: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Episode recap: fatmascara.com/blog; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara / Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: +1-646-481-8182.

Become a member at https://plus.acast.com/s/fatmascara.

item.title: Ep. 301: Talking Body Acceptance & Beauty with Megababe’s Katie Sturino
item.itunes:title: Ep. 301: Talking Body Acceptance & Beauty with Megababe’s Katie Sturino
item.itunes:subtitle: Body acceptance is great in theory, but how do you actually get there? Katie Sturino can help. In this episode, the style influencer behind The 12ish Style and beauty brand Megababe, and author of the forthcoming book Body Talk, shares her journey to s...
item.description:
Body acceptance is great in theory, but how do you actually get there? Katie Sturino can help. In this episode, the style influencer behind The 12ish Style and beauty brand Megababe, and author of the forthcoming book Body Talk, shares her journey to self-acceptance and tips for stopping the negative thought cycle. Plus, she explains why boob sweat, thigh chafe, and a melasma mustache are nothing to be ashamed of. -- For a list of products featured in this episode: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Episode recap: fatmascara.com/blog; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara / Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: 646-481-8182.

item.description:
To celebrate 300 episodes of their award-winning beauty podcast, Jess and Jenn revisit the launch show where they interviewed each other. In this special podcast, they share real-time commentary and behind-the-scenes details as they update their answers; reveal their favorite beauty products; and share the best (and worst!) beauty treatments, most cringe-worthy moments in their careers, and details of what really happens during their celebrity interviews. -- For a list of products featured in this episode: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Episode recap: fatmascara.com/blog; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara / Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: 646-481-8182.

item.title: Ep. 299: How to Be Kind to Your Face with Writer Valerie Monroe
item.itunes:title: Ep. 299: How to Be Kind to Your Face with Writer Valerie Monroe
item.itunes:subtitle: Shift your self-criticism to self-compassion with the help of Valerie Monroe, creator of the How Not To F*ck Up Your Face newsletter. In this episode, Val discusses the power of de-objectifying your looks (and how she learned to do it); some of her fav...
item.description:
Shift your self-criticism to self-compassion with the help of Valerie Monroe, creator of the How Not To F*ck Up Your Face newsletter. In this episode, Val discusses the power of de-objectifying your looks (and how she learned to do it); some of her favorite products; how to make skincare and makeup more fun; and a few things she knows for sure after serving as the beauty director of O, The Oprah magazine for almost 16 years. -- For a list of products featured in this episode: myshlf.us/fatmascara; To subscribe to Val's newsletter: valeriemonroe.substack.com/welcome; Episode recap: fatmascara.com/blog; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara / Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: +1-646-481-8182.

item.itunes:title: Ep. 298: The Truth About Skincare Expiration Dates & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:subtitle: Before you do any spring cleaning, listen to this! We talked to a cosmetic chemist about how long skincare products are safe and effective, and whether those expiration dates really matter. Before that: Does drinking chlorophyll water help with acne? P...
item.description:
Before you do any spring cleaning, listen to this! We talked to a cosmetic chemist about how long skincare products are safe and effective, and whether those expiration dates really matter. Before that: Does drinking chlorophyll water help with acne? Plus, lots of news to discuss: the trendy haircut we love (minus the name); why your favorite perfume might smell different next year; a surprising survey about sun-safety knowledge; and more. -- For a list of products featured in this episode: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Episode recap: fatmascara.com/blog; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara / Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: 646-481-8182.

item.itunes:title: Ep. 297: Demystifying Perfume with Fragrance Writer Tania Sanchez
item.itunes:subtitle: We're so excited to introduce you to the co-author of one of our favorite books, Perfumes: The A–Z Guide. In this interview, Tania Sanchez reveals the hidden love story in her book’s pages, explains how she thinks (and writes) about scent, and tel...
item.description:
We're so excited to introduce you to the co-author of one of our favorite books, Perfumes: The A–Z Guide. In this interview, Tania Sanchez reveals the hidden love story in her book’s pages, explains how she thinks (and writes) about scent, and tells us about some of her favorite perfumes. Plus, we talk about how to move the fragrance world forward and make the art of perfumery more inclusive and easier to understand and enjoy. -- For a list of products featured in this episode: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Episode recap: fatmascara.com/blog; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara / Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: 646-481-8182.

item.title: Ep. 296: Help for Droopy Eyelids & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 296: Help for Droopy Eyelids & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:subtitle: If you have tired, sleepy-looking eyes, we’ve got help! We’re taking a closer look at a new prescription eye drop for ptosis (drooping eyelids) and sharing other tricks to give saggy lids a lift, including a genius makeup tip that really works. Plus, l...
item.description:
If you have tired, sleepy-looking eyes, we’ve got help! We’re taking a closer look at a new prescription eye drop for ptosis (drooping eyelids) and sharing other tricks to give saggy lids a lift, including a genius makeup tip that really works. Plus, lots of news to discuss: the trouble with doctors on TikTok; a new trend called “lip wings”; paying for Botox with Bitcoin; important sunscreen news for summer travel; Lizzo’s partnership with Dove to fight digital photo distortion; and more. -- For a list of products featured in this episode: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Episode recap: fatmascara.com/blog; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara / Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: 646-481-8182.

item.title: Ep. 295: Happy Earth Day + Interview (Replay) with Michelle Wong of Lab Muffin
item.itunes:title: Ep. 295: Happy Earth Day + Interview (Replay) with Michelle Wong of Lab Muffin
item.itunes:subtitle: We've got a quick announcement about Earth Day and our virtual party, then it's on to the interview (a replay): Lab Muffin creator and science educator Michelle Wong, PhD, is going to change the way you think about beauty products. Together, ...
item.description:
We've got a quick announcement about Earth Day and our virtual party, then it's on to the interview (a replay): Lab Muffin creator and science educator Michelle Wong, PhD, is going to change the way you think about beauty products. Together, we take a closer look at the clean-beauty movement, discuss the racist and colorist history of skin-lightening products, discuss how to evaluate user reviews for authenticity, and learn how to avoid confirmation bias so we can be better beauty consumers. -- To register for our Earth Day party on April 22 (tonight!) at 8 PM EST: fatmascara.com/davines; For a list of products featured in this episode: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Episode recap: fatmascara.com/blog; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara / Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: 646-481-8182.

item.title: Ep. 294: Join Us for an Earth Day Party! + Interview (Replay) with Caroline Hirons
item.itunes:title: Ep. 294: Join Us for an Earth Day Party! + Interview (Replay) with Caroline Hirons
item.itunes:subtitle: We’re hosting a virtual Earth Day party this Thursday and we want to tell you all about it (It’s free! And there's an amazing gift for all attendees!). After that, we’re replaying an interview with one of our favorite guests, Caroline Hirons. The ...
item.description:
We’re hosting a virtual Earth Day party this Thursday and we want to tell you all about it (It’s free! And there's an amazing gift for all attendees!). After that, we’re replaying an interview with one of our favorite guests, Caroline Hirons. The skincare expert, aesthetician, and best-selling author gives us her no-nonsense take on “clean” beauty, INCI lists, the Environmental Working Group (EWG), the beauty industry patriarchy, myths about pores, acid solutions, hyaluronic acid, and so much more. Plus, she shares the correct order to apply your skincare and some of her favorite products. -- To register for our Earth Day party on April 22 at 8 PM EST: fatmascara.com/davines; For a list of products featured in this episode: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Episode recap: fatmascara.com/blog; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara / Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: 646-481-8182.

item.title: Ep. 293: All About Soap with Chris Buckley of Bradford Soap Works
item.itunes:title: Ep. 293: All About Soap with Chris Buckley of Bradford Soap Works
item.itunes:subtitle: You'll never look at a bar of soap the same way again after listening to this episode. Chris Buckley, the executive vice president of customer experience for Bradford Soap Works, explains how soap is made, why some bars ...
item.description:
You'll never look at a bar of soap the same way again after listening to this episode. Chris Buckley, the executive vice president of customer experience for Bradford Soap Works, explains how soap is made, why some bars feel more luxurious than others, and what on earth a "syndet" bar is (and why dermatologists love them). Also, Buckley gets into the soap world's impact on the environment, and how companies' and consumers' choices have an impact on the state of our planet. All this, and lots more bubbly trivia! -- For a list of products featured in this episode: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Episode recap: fatmascara.com/blog; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara / Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: 646-481-8182.

item.title: Ep. 292: Solid Shampoo Bars & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 292: Solid Shampoo Bars & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:subtitle: We’re joined this week by our intern/Southern correspondent Valerie, who kicks off the episode with her favorite product—a skincare tonic that keeps her skin bouncy as a Squishmallow. This week’s big topic: solid shampoo bars. We know they’re good for ...
item.description:
We’re joined this week by our intern/Southern correspondent Valerie, who kicks off the episode with her favorite product—a skincare tonic that keeps her skin bouncy as a Squishmallow. This week’s big topic: solid shampoo bars. We know they’re good for the environment, but how do you actually use them? Prepare to be surprised, because we’ve been doing it wrong this whole time. Before that, loads of beauty news to discuss: Estée Lauder Companies is winding down Rodin Olio Lusso; Kim Kardashian is getting into the skincare game; Jen Atkin partners with e.l.f. Cosmetics; Justine Bateman gets real about aging; and Guerlain offers a simple way you can help the bees.

Become a member at https://plus.acast.com/s/fatmascara.

item.itunes:title: Ep. 291: The Future of Skin Cancer Treatment with Dr. Orit Markowitz
item.itunes:subtitle: How do you know if a mole is cancerous or not? What does blue light do to your skin? Do all skin cancers need to be cut out? Dermatologist Orit Markowitz, MD, the founder of OptiSkin, is here to answers all those questions and tell us about the latest ...
item.description:
How do you know if a mole is cancerous or not? What does blue light do to your skin? Do all skin cancers need to be cut out? Dermatologist Orit Markowitz, MD, the founder of OptiSkin, is here to answers all those questions and tell us about the latest (noninvasive!) advancements in skin cancer treatment—many of which she pioneered. -- For a list of products featured in this episode: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Episode recap: fatmascara.com/blog; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara / Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: 646-481-8182.

item.description:
Welcome to our garden party! We’ll tell you why rose water is so great for skin (in a segment sponsored by Crabtree & Evelyn). Before that, we dig into the latest beauty news: racism against the AAPI community and what the beauty world can do; an animal-testing ban in Virginia; the fake online beauty retailer that helps domestic abuse victims; a gin byproduct that’s getting upcycled into beauty products; and new research that explains why odors trigger memories. item.itunes:title: Ep. 280: Under-Eye Issues & The Week's Beauty News with Co-Host Charlotte Palermino
item.itunes:subtitle: Meet your skincare fairy godmother, Charlotte Palermino, aka @charlotteparler, the co-founder of Dieux Skin—and our final guest co-host before Jess is back! We talk about whether “skin purging” is really a thing, the best ways to treat eye bags and cro...
item.description:
Meet your skincare fairy godmother, Charlotte Palermino, aka @charlotteparler, the co-founder of Dieux Skin—and our final guest co-host before Jess is back! We talk about whether “skin purging” is really a thing, the best ways to treat eye bags and crow’s feet, our favorite antioxidant serums and sunscreens, and more. Plus, we discuss the news: how the beauty community is responding to the rise of anti-Asian violence in the United States; Glow Recipe banning the terms “poreless” and “flawless” in marketing; and new research showing how “pretty privilege” affects the way sexual harassment victims are treated. -- For a list of products featured in this episode: myshlf.us/fatmascara; Episode recap: fatmascara.com/blog; Our private Facebook Group: Fat Mascara / Raising a Wand; Instagram: @fatmascara, @jessicamatlin, @jenn_edit; Email: info@fatmascara.com; To submit a "Raise A Wand" product recommendation & be featured on a future episode: 646-481-8182.

item.title: Ep. 273: How Special-Effects Teeth Are Made for Movies
item.itunes:title: Ep. 273: How Special-Effects Teeth Are Made for Movies
item.itunes:subtitle: Dental technician Gary Archer has made specialized teeth for hundreds of movies and TV shows, including Austin Powers, PEN15, The Wolf of Wall Street, Mrs. Doubtfire, Interview with the Vampire, and more. He explains how he collaborates with Special FX...
item.description:
Dental technician Gary Archer has made specialized teeth for hundreds of movies and TV shows, including Austin Powers, PEN15, The Wolf of Wall Street, Mrs. Doubtfire, Interview with the Vampire, and more. He explains how he collaborates with Special FX makeup artists to create a character's look and tells us which movie smiles he’s made that you probably didn’t realize were fake. Plus, he shares stories from his work with actors like Kirsten Dunst, Tom Hanks, Adam Sandler, and others. -- Want more of our beauty podcast? item.itunes:title: Ep. 272: Lip Balm Addiction, Vaccines and Fillers & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:subtitle: Can you get addicted to lip balm? We’re sharing the definitive answer from an expert—but, tbh, we’ll probably ask again next year. Plus, we talked to a dermatologist about why a few people with cosmetic fillers had allergic reactions after getting thei...
item.description:
Can you get addicted to lip balm? We’re sharing the definitive answer from an expert—but, tbh, we’ll probably ask again next year. Plus, we talked to a dermatologist about why a few people with cosmetic fillers had allergic reactions after getting their COVID-19 vaccine. And there’s lots of beauty news to discuss: animal-testing progress; Unilever’s social-equality goals; a teledermatology report card; and a new way to predict when your hair will go gray. -- Want more of our beauty podcast? item.title: Ep. 267: The (Beauty) Business of Philanthropy with Karissa Bodnar
item.itunes:title: Ep. 267: The (Beauty) Business of Philanthropy with Karissa Bodnar
item.itunes:subtitle: It’s easy to be cynical about cause-related marketing in the beauty industry—until you listen to this interview with Karissa Bodnar, the CEO of Thrive Causemetics. We talk about why she built philanthropy into her business model, how her company choose...
item.description:
It’s easy to be cynical about cause-related marketing in the beauty industry—until you listen to this interview with Karissa Bodnar, the CEO of Thrive Causemetics. We talk about why she built philanthropy into her business model, how her company chooses which causes to support and navigates the politics of giving, the product formulations she’s proudest of—and the one product she wishes she could figure out how to invent. -- Want more of our beauty podcast? item.description:
Should you exfoliate if you’re using retinol? If so, how do you do it safely? We’ve got answers from dermatologist Ranella Hirsch, MD, along with a review of the new version of L’Oréal Paris’s cult-favorite Wonder Water. Plus, all the beauty news: Aveda goes vegan; Dolly Parton is creating a fragrance; the return of chunky highlights (at least on Bella Hadid); plastic surgery trends in South Korea; and more. -- Want more of our beauty podcast? item.title: Ep. 264: New Year, New Questions & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 264: New Year, New Questions & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:subtitle: We’re kicking off 2021 with an update to the “FM 5”—the five quick questions we ask all our guests at the end of their interviews. To celebrate, we answer the new questions (which *you* helped create!), and then share our resolutions for the year. Plus...
item.description:
We’re kicking off 2021 with an update to the “FM 5”—the five quick questions we ask all our guests at the end of their interviews. To celebrate, we answer the new questions (which *you* helped create!), and then share our resolutions for the year. Plus, lots of beauty news to discuss: makeup artist Pat McGrath’s damehood; virtual makeup testing via Google; the popularity of nostalgic perfumes during the pandemic; research showing that very thin bodies are less admired than people think; and a surprising new use for unscented pantiliners.-- Want more of our beauty podcast? item.itunes:title: Ep. 262: Mario Dedivanovic’s Makeup Masterclass (Replay)
item.itunes:subtitle: Mario Dedivanovic—the founder of Makeup By Mario and makeup artist to stars such as Kim Kardashian, Christina Aguilera, and Priyanka Chopra—is here to share all his secrets. He discusses his first job in beauty (as a fragrance consultant at Sephora), w...
item.description:
Mario Dedivanovic—the founder of Makeup By Mario and makeup artist to stars such as Kim Kardashian, Christina Aguilera, and Priyanka Chopra—is here to share all his secrets. He discusses his first job in beauty (as a fragrance consultant at Sephora), why he uses makeup brushes on celebrities but his fingers on models, the importance of eyelash curlers, and why you should put tinted moisturizer on your eyelids. This episode features a new introduction and Raise A Wand segment, but the interview previously aired (episode 132). We’ll be back next week with all new episodes for 2021! -- Want more of our beauty podcast? item.itunes:subtitle: We’re sharing all the ways you can support the beauty professionals at your local spas and salons this holiday season and recommending our favorite HSA/FSA-eligible sunscreens and skincare to buy with the leftover money in your health savings account (...
item.description:
We’re sharing all the ways you can support the beauty professionals at your local spas and salons this holiday season and recommending our favorite HSA/FSA-eligible sunscreens and skincare to buy with the leftover money in your health savings account (if you have one). Plus, lots of news to discuss: Purito’s sunscreen scandal; *another* celebrity skincare line; makeup artist Sir John’s collaboration with Barbie; Trojan’s fragrance launch; and important info about fragrance allergens and how they might be mislabeled on some products. -- Want more of our beauty podcast? item.title: Ep. 258: Why Celebrities Don’t Talk About Their Botox & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:title: Ep. 258: Why Celebrities Don’t Talk About Their Botox & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:subtitle: Why don’t more celebrities and influencers open up about what it *really* takes to look the way they do? On this episode, we discuss how their honestly could benefit others and why it’s important to remember that “looking good for your age” is a privil...
item.description:
Why don’t more celebrities and influencers open up about what it *really* takes to look the way they do? On this episode, we discuss how their honestly could benefit others and why it’s important to remember that “looking good for your age” is a privilege not afforded to everyone. Plus, lots of beauty news to share: the legacy of Benefit Cosmetics co-founder Jane Ford; Jo Malone London’s floral collaboration; the FTC cracking down on razor monopolies; Young King, a new line for boys with textured hair; and the expansion of Martha Stewart’s CBD line. -- Want more of our beauty podcast? item.description:

item.description:
Model and musician Karen Elson gets brutally honest about her journey in fashion, and what needs to change. In this interview, Elson talks candidly about the personal challenges she went through with body image and bullying in the press, and where she feels the fashion industry was complicit. She also talks about progress in models' rights and inclusivity, two major areas where the business is beginning to make strides. -- Want more of our beauty podcast? item.title: Special Ep. 245: How Fragrance Reflects the World We Live In
item.itunes:title: Special Ep. 245: How Fragrance Reflects the World We Live In
item.itunes:subtitle: Fragrance is a way for us to make sense of our world; learn more about who we are and what we want for our society and ourselves; and boost our mood and regulate our emotions. In this special podcast, we talk to Firmenich Fine Fragran...
item.description:
Fragrance is a way for us to make sense of our world; learn more about who we are and what we want for our society and ourselves; and boost our mood and regulate our emotions. In this special podcast, we talk to Firmenich Fine Fragrance experts Justin Welch, the Creative Director of the Mind Nose + Matter program, and Frank Voelkl, Principal Perfumer, to learn how fragrance can bring us comfort, what makes certain scents addictive, how perfumers are creating more sustainable fragrances, and what the future will smell like. -- This episode is brought to commercial-free by Firmenich, a leading business-to-business company operating primarily in the flavors and fragrances market, involved in the research, creation, manufacture and sale of perfumes, flavors and ingredients. To learn more about Firmenich and the 2020 Mind Nose + Matter REGENERATION themed trend report, please visit: https://regeneration.firmenich.com and @FirmenichFine. #RegenerationReset #FragranceIsCulture

Become a member at https://plus.acast.com/s/fatmascara.

item.itunes:title: Ep. 242: Deep Thoughts on Emily in Paris & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:subtitle: Bonjour, Fat Mascara Family! Indulge us this week, as we take a deep dive into Netflix’s Emily in Paris. The fashion, the hair, the characters, and the show’s depictions of the beauty industry, perfumers, and influencer culture—we’re discussing it all....
item.description:
Bonjour, Fat Mascara Family! Indulge us this week, as we take a deep dive into Netflix’s Emily in Paris. The fashion, the hair, the characters, and the show’s depictions of the beauty industry, perfumers, and influencer culture—we’re discussing it all. Before that, we’ll bring you up to speed on the beauty news, including an increase in body-care sales, SheaMoisture’s It Comes Naturally campaign, Khloé Kardashian’s investment in collagen brand Dose & Co, and beauty companies that are becoming more inclusive of people with visible and invisible disabilities. -- Want more of our beauty podcast? Before that, we’ll bring you up to speed on the beauty news, including an increase in body-care sales, SheaMoisture’s It Comes Naturally campaign, Khloé Kardashian’s investment in collagen brand Dose & Co, and beauty companies that are becoming more inclusive of people with visible and invisible disabilities. -- Want more of our beauty podcast? Byredo founder Ben Gorham built a fragrance brand that helped define the scent of the past decade. So, what’s next? In this revealing conversation, he explains how he turns memories into perfumes, why luxury doesn’t need to be exclusive, and the story behind Byredo's new makeup collaboration with Isamaya Ffrench. Listen in to find out how a Swedish pro basketball player with family ties to India and Canada became perfume’s indie darling. -- Want more of our beauty podcast? item.title: Ep. 237: Fashion Designer Jenna Lyons on Her Move to Beauty
item.itunes:title: Ep. 237: Fashion Designer Jenna Lyons on Her Move to Beauty
item.itunes:subtitle: Fashion designer Jenna Lyons opens up about leaving J. Crew after 27 years and explains how being born without brows—and with very few lashes—has affected her beauty philosophy. In a revealing conversation, we discuss LoveSeen, the new beauty line she ...
item.description:
Fashion designer Jenna Lyons opens up about leaving J. Crew after 27 years and explains how being born without brows—and with very few lashes—has affected her beauty philosophy. In a revealing conversation, we discuss LoveSeen, the new beauty line she co-created with makeup artist Troi Ollivierre; how faux lashes are manufactured; her favorite beauty products; why her son won’t let her switch perfumes; and her thoughts on the state of fashion and beauty today. -- Want more of our beauty podcast? item.description:
In this intimate conversation with Kim Kardashian West and Allison Statter, the best friends discuss their relationship and their new KKW Beauty collection. On the agenda: early memories of Kim’s dad; the secret pager codes they used in high school; the struggle to balance work and motherhood (and law school!); and their fascination with Marilyn Monroe and Princess Diana. Listen in for beauty tips, friendship advice—and deep thoughts on Crocs, Madonna, and the best MAC lip pencil. No topic is off limits! -- Want more of our beauty podcast? item.title: Ep. 225: How Funmi Fetto Wrote the Beauty Bible for Women of Color
item.itunes:title: Ep. 225: How Funmi Fetto Wrote the Beauty Bible for Women of Color
item.itunes:subtitle: Beauty and fashion journalist Funmi Fetto (British Vogue, The Observer) has tested thousands of beauty products, and she shares the absolute best picks for women of color, how she chose them, and why she needed to write her book, Palette: The ...
item.description:
Beauty and fashion journalist Funmi Fetto (British Vogue, The Observer) has tested thousands of beauty products, and she shares the absolute best picks for women of color, how she chose them, and why she needed to write her book, Palette: The Beauty Bible for Women of Color. She also tells us about her inspiring career, and we discuss cancel culture, industry watchdogs, performative allyship, and why inclusivity is more than a beauty trend. -- Want more of our beauty podcast? item.title: Ep. 221: Tracee Ellis Ross on the Power of Authentic Beauty
item.itunes:title: Ep. 221: Tracee Ellis Ross on the Power of Authentic Beauty
item.itunes:subtitle: Award-winning actor Tracee Ellis Ross, founder of the haircare line Pattern, gets candid about everything: her hair, your hair, customer reviews, ageism in Hollywood, experiments with DIY waxing, her love of Funyuns ...
item.description:
Award-winning actor Tracee Ellis Ross, founder of the haircare line Pattern, gets candid about everything: her hair, your hair, customer reviews, ageism in Hollywood, experiments with DIY waxing, her love of Funyuns and red lipstick, her hatred of flaky hair gels, and her love/hate of home workouts. Plus, she shares behind-the-scenes secrets from Black•ish, Mixed•ish, and her new movie, The High Note. If you want to bring joy to your beauty routine and learn how to celebrate yourself authentically, this conversation is a must-listen. -- Want more Fat Mascara? item.itunes:title: Ep. 220: Makeup for Men, Our Podcasting Secrets & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:subtitle: There’s a new makeup line for men, but do cosmetics still need to be gendered? We discuss and then answer a listener question about how we create the podcast each week. Plus, lots of beauty news to talk about: The “Keurig of skincare” is coming this fa...
item.description:
There’s a new makeup line for men, but do cosmetics still need to be gendered? We discuss and then answer a listener question about how we create the podcast each week. Plus, lots of beauty news to talk about: The “Keurig of skincare” is coming this fall; Gucci Bloom launched a new campaign; perfumers re-created a 150-year-old fragrance discovered in a shipwreck; and researchers have figured out what goosebumps are good for. We also Raise A Wand to our current obsessions—and listen to a few of your favorites, too! -- Want more Fat Mascara? item.title: Ep. 219: How Dr. Paul Jarrod Frank is Changing the Conversation on Aging
item.itunes:title: Ep. 219: How Dr. Paul Jarrod Frank is Changing the Conversation on Aging
item.itunes:subtitle: Cosmetic dermatologist Dr. Paul Jarrod Frank joins us to talk about his new book, "The Pro-Aging Playbook," which dares to go deeper than others in its category. Expect straight talk (mixed with a little spirituality) about our youth-obsessed...
item.description:
Cosmetic dermatologist Dr. Paul Jarrod Frank joins us to talk about his new book, "The Pro-Aging Playbook," which dares to go deeper than others in its category. Expect straight talk (mixed with a little spirituality) about our youth-obsessed culture, and real advice about how you can block out the noise focus on looking and feeling your best. Also, grab a pencil: Dr. Frank shares *exactly* what to look for in a practitioner, should you ever decide to get injectables or anything more serious. -- Want more Fat Mascara? Creative director Drew Elliot, formerly of Paper and America’s Next Top Model, is the new global creative director of MAC Cosmetics, and he’s here to discuss how pop culture influences makeup (and vice versa), how the beauty brand is working to become more diverse and inclusive, new collaborations, his favorite MAC classics, and what goes into his creative process (Peanut M&M's are involved). We hope you enjoy our first Thursday episode! -- Want more Fat Mascara? item.itunes:title: Ep. 216: Oxidizing Makeup, DIY Pineapple Masks & The Week’s Beauty News
item.itunes:subtitle: Welcome to our new format! Every Tuesday, we'll talk about the beauty news, answer your questions, share tips and advice, and just generally hang out and have fun. Every Thursday, we’ll drop a (slightly longer) episode featuring an interview with ...
item.description:
Welcome to our new format! Every Tuesday, we'll talk about the beauty news, answer your questions, share tips and advice, and just generally hang out and have fun. Every Thursday, we’ll drop a (slightly longer) episode featuring an interview with a big name in the beauty world. ••• In this episode, we explain why makeup can change colors as you wear it (and what to do about it), find out if pineapple is actually good for your skin, and discuss the headlines: Morphe cuts ties with Jeffree Star; Patrick Starrr launches a new line; Lady Gaga fronts Valentino’s new fragrance; Gabrielle Union and Larry Sims relaunch their hair care brand; perms are back; and Dior Perfumes releases a podcast. -- Want more Fat Mascara? item.title: Ep. 215: How to Shop for Skincare Like a Scientist
item.itunes:title: Ep. 215: How to Shop for Skincare Like a Scientist
item.itunes:subtitle: Lab Muffin creator and science educator Michelle Wong, PhD, takes a closer look at the clean-beauty movement, discusses the racist and colorist history of skin-lightening products, teaches you to evaluate user reviews for authenticity, and explains how...
item.description:
Lab Muffin creator and science educator Michelle Wong, PhD, takes a closer look at the clean-beauty movement, discusses the racist and colorist history of skin-lightening products, teaches you to evaluate user reviews for authenticity, and explains how to avoid confirmation bias so you can be a better beauty consumer. Before the interview, Jess & Jenn share makeup-removal tips and discuss the week’s beauty news: a possible end to animal-testing requirements on cosmetics imported to China; beauty trucks and salons on wheels; Alpyn Beauty’s “plastic-neutral” pledge; and Floratropia, an eco-friendly fragrance brand. -- Want more Fat Mascara? item.title: Ep. 214: Do Beauty Supplements Really Work?
item.itunes:title: Ep. 214: Do Beauty Supplements Really Work?
item.itunes:subtitle: Dr. Rajani Katta, a dermatologist and nutrition expert, explains how vitamins are (and aren’t!) regulated, how to judge the safety and efficacy of supplements, and the truth about collagen powders, biotin, vitamin A, and other hair, skin, and nail vita...
item.description:
Dr. Rajani Katta, a dermatologist and nutrition expert, explains how vitamins are (and aren’t!) regulated, how to judge the safety and efficacy of supplements, and the truth about collagen powders, biotin, vitamin A, and other hair, skin, and nail vitamins. Before the interview, Jenn & Jess talk about the beauty industry’s continued fixation on “unboxing” and discuss the week’s beauty news: more brands dropping the racist language used to market skin-evening products, Space NK’s U.S. store closures, Coty’s investment in KKW Beauty, the first curbside-recyclable pump for a skincare product, a perfume that smells like space, and the health risks of the preservative butylparaben.


Want more Fat Mascara?

item.title: Ep. 213: Lisa Eldridge Teaches You to Be Your Own Makeup Artist
item.itunes:title: Ep. 213: Lisa Eldridge Teaches You to Be Your Own Makeup Artist
item.itunes:subtitle: Makeup artist and YouTube creator Lisa Eldridge helps you see yourself in a kinder light, explains the different face types and how to identify your best features, and shares a genius trick for concealing capillaries and other imperfections. She also e...
item.description:
Makeup artist and YouTube creator Lisa Eldridge helps you see yourself in a kinder light, explains the different face types and how to identify your best features, and shares a genius trick for concealing capillaries and other imperfections. She also explains what really happens behind the scenes of beauty-advertisement photo shoots (!) and talks about her favorite products and the artists, jewelers, and people who inspire her. Before the interview, Jess & Jenn offer help for underarm discoloration and chat about the beauty news: companies phasing out racist skin “lightening” products; Pattern Beauty's new launch; KKW Beauty's legal drama; and an FDA warning about a dangerous ingredient discovered in some hand sanitizers.

item.title: Ep. 212: Beauty Innovations You Need to Know About
item.itunes:title: Ep. 212: Beauty Innovations You Need to Know About
item.itunes:subtitle: Virtual makeup, bacteria-based moisturizers, a new body tool inspired by ancient history—we're geeking out this episode! We answer a listener question about probiotic skincare; chat about Esker’s body plane, a tool inspired by Greek warriors; and ...
item.description:
Virtual makeup, bacteria-based moisturizers, a new body tool inspired by ancient history—we're geeking out this episode! We answer a listener question about probiotic skincare; chat about Esker’s body plane, a tool inspired by Greek warriors; and discuss the future of beauty with special correspondent Christopher Skinner of School House. Plus, we’ve got all the beauty headlines: an initiative to raise venture capital for businesses owned by Black women; how makeup is protecting protestors; MAC’s virtual looks for The Sims 4; Shiseido research on the benefits of face massage; and new launches from Morphe, Zitsticka, Westman Atelier, and…Yeezy?

item.title: Ep. 211: Huda Kattan Explains How She Became A Beauty Boss
item.itunes:title: Ep. 211: Huda Kattan Explains How She Became A Beauty Boss
item.itunes:subtitle: Huda Beauty founder Huda Kattan built a blog into a beauty empire and is here to talk about it. She shares the secrets to doing makeup for beauty photography; why getting fired was one of the best things that ever happened to her; and how she knows whe...
item.description:
Huda Beauty founder Huda Kattan built a blog into a beauty empire and is here to talk about it. She shares the secrets to doing makeup for beauty photography; why getting fired was one of the best things that ever happened to her; and how she knows when a new product idea (and formula!) will be a winner. Before we talk to Huda, Jess gets help for post-pregnancy hair shedding and we discuss the beauty headlines: Uoma Beauty founder and CEO Sharon Chuter launches the Pull Up or Shut Up campaign; Sephora agrees to the 15% challenge; L’Oréal reconciles with influencer Munroe Bergdorf and collaborates with Albéa to launch paper-based tubes for its products.

item.title: Ep. 210: How Stress Affects Your Skin with Dr. Amy Wechsler
item.itunes:title: Ep. 210: How Stress Affects Your Skin with Dr. Amy Wechsler
item.itunes:subtitle: Acne, psoriasis, skin picking, wrinkles—all these skin issues have a mental-health component, and Dr. Amy Wechsler, a board-certified psychiatrist and dermatologist, is here to talk about them. She explains how stress affects your body, why humans are ...
item.description:
Acne, psoriasis, skin picking, wrinkles—all these skin issues have a mental-health component, and Dr. Amy Wechsler, a board-certified psychiatrist and dermatologist, is here to talk about them. She explains how stress affects your body, why humans are hardwired to self-soothe with skincare, and how to help friends and family suffering from mental-heath-related skin issues. Before the interview, Jess & Jenn share new sunscreen news from Neutrogena and discuss the week’s beauty headlines: how the Black Lives Matter movement is reshaping the beauty industry for the better; Burberry’s new global beauty director; a study of Covid-19’s effect on psoriasis patients; Ah-Shí, the first Native American-owned beauty store; and Puig's acquisition of Charlotte Tilbury cosmetics.


Want more Fat Mascara?

item.description:
Hairstylist Nikki Nelms has worked with Janelle Monáe, Zoë Kravitz, Solange Knowles, Björk, Beyoncé—and so many others. In this episode, she explains her creative process, why there are Home Depot supplies in her kit, how she built her amazing career, and her must-have products. We’re also sharing tips for preventing your makeup from transferring onto your face mask and talking about the latest beauty news: Venus Williams’ new EleVen sunscreen, beauty looks in Ariana Grande's “Rain On Me” video, Nixit period cups, and a spike in DIY beauty searches online.

item.title: Ep. 208: How Makeup Artist Jillian Dempsey is Making Beauty Tutorials Better
item.itunes:title: Ep. 208: How Makeup Artist Jillian Dempsey is Making Beauty Tutorials Better
item.itunes:subtitle: Makeup Artist Jillian Dempsey—who works with Gwyneth Paltrow and Kristen Stewart—tells about launching her new beauty app, FYFE, in the midst of a pandemic; her wrinkle-smoothing Gold Sculpting Bar; and her favorite beauty finds (you likely haven'...
item.description:
Makeup Artist Jillian Dempsey—who works with Gwyneth Paltrow and Kristen Stewart—tells about launching her new beauty app, FYFE, in the midst of a pandemic; her wrinkle-smoothing Gold Sculpting Bar; and her favorite beauty finds (you likely haven't heard of these before). Of course, we had to ask her about her days running the legendary Delux salon in L.A., where she met her client-turned-husband, actor Patrick Dempsey. Also in this episode: Jess talks about solutions for bikini line bumps and we discuss the salon experience in a post-pandemic world. Plus, we discuss the week's beauty news, including Johnson & Johnson's plan to stop selling talc-based baby powder in the U.S., Jeffree Star's controversial new makeup line, Kristen Bell's venture into CBD, and more.

item.title: Ep. 207: Supplements, Sustainability, and More
item.itunes:title: Ep. 207: Supplements, Sustainability, and More
item.itunes:subtitle: There's a lot to talk about this week! We discuss one of Jess’s favorite stores closing, which skincare supplements actually work, and the week's beauty headlines: Ulta sponsors R29Somos, a Latinx beauty and style website; the FDA approves a ...
item.description:
There's a lot to talk about this week! We discuss one of Jess’s favorite stores closing, which skincare supplements actually work, and the week's beauty headlines: Ulta sponsors R29Somos, a Latinx beauty and style website; the FDA approves a new lip filler; CBD line Uncle Bud partners with Jane Fonda; and L’Oréal launches a new program supporting women and the environment. Plus, we’re talking about sustainability with Christopher Skinner, principal and founder of School House—and now a special correspondent to Fat Mascara. He discusses what the word “sustainability” means to brands and consumers today. Has it become less of a priority because of the pandemic, or has it never been more important?

item.itunes:title: Ep. 206: Meet the Woman Behind the Beautyblender, Rea Ann Silva
item.itunes:subtitle: Makeup artist Rea Ann Silva, inventor of the Beautyblender, explains how makeup application changed with the advent of HD television—and how that shift inspired her million-dollar idea, the Beautyblender makeup sponge. Also in this episode: Jess shares...
item.description:
Makeup artist Rea Ann Silva, inventor of the Beautyblender, explains how makeup application changed with the advent of HD television—and how that shift inspired her million-dollar idea, the Beautyblender makeup sponge. Also in this episode: Jess shares her home hair-color adventures, and we talk about blue-light protection for skin. Plus, we discuss the week’s beauty news, including the nose-blush trend, “pandemicure” must-haves, Caroline Hirons’ rumored plans for a skincare line, and Jessica Simpson’s response to the body-shamers.

item.title: Ep. 204: Makeup Artist Kristofer Buckle is Back!
item.itunes:title: Ep. 204: Makeup Artist Kristofer Buckle is Back!
item.itunes:subtitle: By popular demand, celebrity makeup artist Kristofer Buckle returns to the show. He explains why wearing makeup can be a sign of respect, tells us what it’s like in Mariah Carey’s quarantine house, plus shares tips for keeping your job. He als...
item.description:
By popular demand, celebrity makeup artist Kristofer Buckle returns to the show. He explains why wearing makeup can be a sign of respect, tells us what it’s like in Mariah Carey’s quarantine house, plus shares tips for keeping your job. He also gives amazing beauty tips for tight-lining your upper lash lines, finding the right blush for your skin tone, and updating your makeup as you get older. Plus: Jenn & Jess weigh in on Fat Mascara listeners’ “unpopular beauty opinions" and discuss the week’s beauty headlines (sales numbers for clean beauty and CBD products, news on an animal-testing ban in Brazil, DIY dermatology trends on TikTok, and the launch of Support Creatives, an initiative to support beauty pros during the pandemic).

We sit down with Christopher Skinner, the founder and principal of School House, beauty's think tank and creative agency. Chris talks about the specific challenges brands face amid the pandemic, how heritage brands can evolve in this moment, and the importance of and secret to creating a real community with customers. He also fields listener questions about design, inspiration, and career advice. This special episode is made possible by our friends at School House. Visit weareschoolhouse.com for more info.

item.title: Bonus Episode: Hairstylist Chris McMillan for Covid-19 Relief
item.itunes:title: Bonus Episode: Hairstylist Chris McMillan for Covid-19 Relief
item.itunes:subtitle: Celebrity stylist and salon owner Chris McMillan joins us for a bonus podcast dedicated to salon workers and beauty professionals: Revenue from audio sponsorships of this episode will be donated to the Professional Beauty Association’s Covid-19 Relief ...
item.description:
Celebrity stylist and salon owner Chris McMillan joins us for a bonus podcast dedicated to salon workers and beauty professionals: Revenue from audio sponsorships of this episode will be donated to the Professional Beauty Association’s Covid-19 Relief Fund.* Chris offers tips for cutting off “old energy” (a.k.a., your hair), shares personal stories (and industry gossip!), discusses his collaboration with Drunk Elephant, and talks about how he and his stylists and employees are getting through this time. 

*Visit probeauty.org to learn more about the fund. Licensed beauty professionals in the U.S.A. can visit www.probeauty.org/pba-charities/covid-19-relief-fund to apply for emergency relief grants.

item.itunes:subtitle: Dermatologist Jeanine Downie, MD, shares everything you ever wanted to know about skincare acids: how they work; the difference between AHAs, BHAs, and PHAs; what facial peels do; how glycolic and salicylic acid interact with other products; a...
item.description:
Dermatologist Jeanine Downie, MD, shares everything you ever wanted to know about skincare acids: how they work; the difference between AHAs, BHAs, and PHAs; what facial peels do; how glycolic and salicylic acid interact with other products; and more! Plus, the sunscreen news hidden in America’s coronavirus relief bill (the CARES Act), Jess and Jenn's favorite at-home exercise classes, and this week’s beauty headlines (virtual assistance from Space NK, Kiehl’s, and Il Makiage and the MAC X Selena collection).

item.title: Ep 199: Ask a Plastic Surgeon with Dr. Lara Devgan
item.itunes:title: Ep 199: Ask a Plastic Surgeon with Dr. Lara Devgan
item.itunes:subtitle: Plastic and reconstructive surgeon Dr. Lara Devgan (@laradevganmd) answers your questions about tummy tucks, liposuction, firm jawlines, crepey necks, breast implants, and more. She also explains how to find a surgeon, cosmetic dermatologist, ...
item.description:
Plastic and reconstructive surgeon Dr. Lara Devgan (@laradevganmd) answers your questions about tummy tucks, liposuction, firm jawlines, crepey necks, breast implants, and more. She also explains how to find a surgeon, cosmetic dermatologist, or nurse injector you trust. Before that, Jenn & Jess discuss who we *actually* wear makeup for, how the diet industrial complex has affected us, and our favorite movies, TV shows, and books for beauty inspiration. Also in this episode: Kybella, neck lifts, RF (radio frequency) treatments, retinoids, hyaluronic acid, vitamin C, sunscreen, Latisse, prostaglandins, and more. Please note: The interview portion of this episode was recorded in January; the other content was recorded remotely this week.

item.itunes:subtitle: Estée Lauder Companies Group President Jane Hertzmark Hudis, who pulls the strings behind many beloved beauty brands, talks about what makes a brand worth acquiring, customer service in 2020, the power of online reviews, her top career advice, and more...
item.description:
Estée Lauder Companies Group President Jane Hertzmark Hudis, who pulls the strings behind many beloved beauty brands, talks about what makes a brand worth acquiring, customer service in 2020, the power of online reviews, her top career advice, and more. Before that, Jenn and guest co-host Gwen Flamberg, the executive editor of beauty & style at Us Weekly, discuss industry headlines (Dyson's new hair tool, scary news about the state of dermatology in the U.S., how Sephora supports women-led businesses, and asbestos in cosmetics); Gwen shares important info about illness-related hair loss; and the duo answer a listener question: When it comes to anti-aging products, where do you even start?

item.itunes:subtitle: Actress, entrepreneur, master of thighs (and butts), and author of 26 (!) books Suzanne Somers talks to Jenn & Jess about how she's handled numerous bouts with cancer, her non-allopathic approach to healing, her must-have supplements ...
item.description:
Actress, entrepreneur, master of thighs (and butts), and author of 26 (!) books Suzanne Somers talks to Jenn & Jess about how she's handled numerous bouts with cancer, her non-allopathic approach to healing, her must-have supplements and skincare, and the beautiful ways she keeps herself young at heart. Before that, Intern Tiff is back in the studio to co-host with Jenn and discuss her beauty tricks, answer a listener question about back acne, and share the news of the week (E.l.f. Cosmetics acquiring W3ll People, Sephora’s new CBD rules, more Harvey Nichols revamps, and Luna Legend’s first haircut).

item.title: Ep. 195: The Instagram Effect with Kristie Dash & Co-Host Maya Allen
item.itunes:title: Ep. 195: The Instagram Effect with Kristie Dash & Co-Host Maya Allen
item.itunes:subtitle: Kristie Dash’s job is to help beauty brands and content creators use Instagram more effectively. Now, she’s sharing the secrets to thumb-stopping content, an inside look at the company’s latest updates and “algorithm” changes—and some of her favorite b...
item.description:
Kristie Dash’s job is to help beauty brands and content creators use Instagram more effectively. Now, she’s sharing the secrets to thumb-stopping content, an inside look at the company’s latest updates and “algorithm” changes—and some of her favorite beauty products. Plus, Jenn and guest co-host Maya Allen, the beauty editor at Marie Claire, talk about the end of beauty trends, help a listener find the perfect nude lip liner, and discuss the week’s beauty news: Olay’s ban on retouching, a new face at Cacharel, a THC-free CBD extract made from orange peels, and the trouble with inhaling powdered titanium dioxide.

item.itunes:subtitle: Cookbook author and New York Times columnist Alison Roman has thoughts on post-breakup dye jobs, broth’s beauty benefits, hair vitamins, the best gel manicure, and the difference between Essie Clambake and Essie Geranium. Also on this episode:...
item.description:
Cookbook author and New York Times columnist Alison Roman has thoughts on post-breakup dye jobs, broth’s beauty benefits, hair vitamins, the best gel manicure, and the difference between Essie Clambake and Essie Geranium. Also on this episode: beauty news (the CROWN Act, the DevaCurl lawsuit, New York Fashion Week, and…Jess had her baby!). Plus, Jenn and Alison test gourmand fragrances and answer a listener question about self-care.

item.description:
Skincare expert Caroline Hirons talks about “clean” beauty, the correct order to apply products, INCI lists, the Environmental Working Group (EWG), and the beauty industry patriarchy. item.title: Ep. 192: Nose Jobs 101 with Dr. David Rosenberg
item.itunes:title: Ep. 192: Nose Jobs 101 with Dr. David Rosenberg
item.itunes:subtitle: Plastic surgeon David Rosenberg, MD, is here to answer all your questions about nose jobs. We discuss how selfies distort your appearance, the most popular noses in America, how to find a good plastic surgeon, and the costs and risks associate...
item.description:
Plastic surgeon David Rosenberg, MD, is here to answer all your questions about nose jobs. We discuss how selfies distort your appearance, the most popular noses in America, how to find a good plastic surgeon, and the costs and risks associated with rhinoplasty. Also in this episode: the beauty news of the week; why more men in Silicon Valley are getting cosmetic work done; and Jess’s *beauty* birth plan (she’s due any day now!). Plus: Hermès lipsticks, Lancôme news, Harrods Beauty Hall, The Goop Lab, blood infusions, parabiosis, Botox, filler, cosmetic injectables, perfume, fragrance, and more.

item.itunes:title: Ep 190: Anastasia Soare Talks Brows, Business, and Beauty
item.itunes:subtitle: Anastasia Beverly Hills founder Anastasia Soare has plucked the arches of Jennifer Lopez, Naomi Campbell, and Michelle Obama. In this episode, she shares the secret to perfect brows, how she built her business into an international powerhouse, and her ...
item.description:
Anastasia Beverly Hills founder Anastasia Soare has plucked the arches of Jennifer Lopez, Naomi Campbell, and Michelle Obama. In this episode, she shares the secret to perfect brows, how she built her business into an international powerhouse, and her favorite products and services. Plus: Jenn & Jess discuss magazine-world news and life updates, pregnancy-safe beauty rules, and the week’s beauty news (from NikkieTutorials, Becca, Clinique, P&G, and Billie). Also in this podcast: skincare for pregnant women, Marie Claire, Harper’s Bazaar, exfoliating without acids, eyebrow tips, brow pencil, brow powder, and more.

Model and nutritionist Maye Musk, 71, opens up about ageism in fashion, her time as a plus-size model, her divorce, working with CoverGirl, and so much more. item.title: Ep. 186: The Truth About MLMs
item.itunes:title: Ep. 186: The Truth About MLMs
item.itunes:subtitle: MLMs, or multi-level marketing brands, have caught the attention of the beauty world—for better or worse. Some see the direct selling business model as entrepreneurial and perfect for the social media age; others see it as predatory, accusing the brand...
item.description:
MLMs, or multi-level marketing brands, have caught the attention of the beauty world—for better or worse. Some see the direct selling business model as entrepreneurial and perfect for the social media age; others see it as predatory, accusing the brands of giving consultants false expectations about what they can expect to earn (and potentially lose). We invited Dr. Thomai Serdari, a professor at NYU’s Stern Business school and a strategist in luxury marketing and branding, to help us wade through this hot button topic. Before that: We share a pro secret for making red hair dye look natural, and we discuss the Netflix series, “Broken,” specifically the episode all about beauty counterfeiting.

item.itunes:title: Ep 185: Dr. Barbara Sturm Says We Shouldn't Suffer for Beauty
item.itunes:subtitle: The founder of Dr. Barbara Sturm Molecular Cosmetics talks about her skincare line, the problems with over-exfoliation, vampire facials (!), and why lowering inflammation and activating telomeres are the keys to great skin. Plus: Our favorite charities...
item.description:
The founder of Dr. Barbara Sturm Molecular Cosmetics talks about her skincare line, the problems with over-exfoliation, vampire facials (!), and why lowering inflammation and activating telomeres are the keys to great skin. Plus: Our favorite charities to support this time of year; why we're obsessed with L’Oréal Elvive 8 Second Wonder Water; and some thoughts about the U.S. congressional hearing on empowering the FDA to improve cosmetics safety.

item.title: Special Mini Ep: The Best Beauty Gifts of the Season
item.itunes:title: Special Mini Ep: The Best Beauty Gifts of the Season
item.itunes:subtitle: Come holiday shopping with us! In this bonus episode, Jenn and Jess share the beauty gifts they're giving friends, family—and each other! All the goodies are from Ulta Beauty—with a special focus on brands from SPARKED at Ulta Be...
item.description:
Come holiday shopping with us! In this bonus episode, Jenn and Jess share the beauty gifts they're giving friends, family—and each other! All the goodies are from Ulta Beauty—with a special focus on brands from SPARKED at Ulta Beauty™—so if you're inspired to do some of your own gift giving, you know exactly where to find everything. item.itunes:subtitle: What's a "white floral" versus a "springtime floral"? Which molecule smells like toasted almonds? What is a "naturally derived" scent? Stephen Nilsen has all the answers! The Givaudan perfumer, who's created many...
item.description:
What's a "white floral" versus a "springtime floral"? Which molecule smells like toasted almonds? What is a "naturally derived" scent? Stephen Nilsen has all the answers! The Givaudan perfumer, who's created many fragrances you know (Madonna's Truth or Dare, Bond No. 9 Union Square, Vera Wang Lovestruck) is here to explain how perfumes are created. Before that, we have help for itchy skin (listen up, moms-to-be!), discuss wild-crafting in beauty, and share our favorite New York City beauty spots.

item.title: Special Ep: Derm Secrets for Strong Skin, with Dr. Erin Gilbert
item.itunes:title: Special Ep: Derm Secrets for Strong Skin, with Dr. Erin Gilbert
item.itunes:subtitle: In this bonus podcast, internationally recognized dermatologist and neuroscientist Erin Gilbert, MD, PhD, FAAD, explains how external and internal daily aggressors (called the exposome) aff...
item.description:
In this bonus podcast, internationally recognized dermatologist and neuroscientist Erin Gilbert, MD, PhD, FAAD, explains how external and internal daily aggressors (called the exposome) affect your complexion, and what you can do to keep it healthy. (Hint: These factors cause 80% skin aging, so skincare matters! Mineral-rich French thermal water may be in order!). This special mini episode was produced in partnership with our friends and skincare experts at Vichy Laboratories. Visit vichyusa.com to learn more about the #1 anti-aging brand in European Pharmacies.

Dr. Shari Auth, co-founder of WTHN, helps demystify the world of Chinese medicine, from acupuncture to herbs. She also shares her tips for getting more zen, even if you can't make it to her buzzy NYC studio. (PS: Her voice may be the most soothing we've ever had on this podcast. Prepare to bliss out.) Before that, we discuss a cool new body treatment, the (surprising) results of the Harper's Bazaar Real Beauty survey, and what to do about bug bites.

Master Perfumer Steve Nicoll discusses a rarely seen side of the fragrance industry: scenting household products. The International Flavors & Fragrances expert explains how he creates popular home products, which aromas connote cleanliness, and why people like the smell of hot metal. item.itunes:title: Ep 136: CBD Beauty and Weedwashing in the Beauty Industry
item.itunes:subtitle: What is CBD? Derek Chase, president of Flora + Bast, is here to help explain why cannabidiol (CBD) is so big in beauty and how it can benefit your skin and mood. He also drops knowledge on the difference between hemp and marijuana, other cannabinoids (...
item.description:
What is CBD? Derek Chase, president of Flora + Bast, is here to help explain why cannabidiol (CBD) is so big in beauty and how it can benefit your skin and mood. He also drops knowledge on the difference between hemp and marijuana, other cannabinoids (like THC), the ketogenic diet, adaptogens, and how to get surfer-boy hair. Before that: We critique the new "universally flattering" makeup shades; Jenn introduces a wild new study about goosebumps; and Jess reveals her Top 5 Cream Shadows of All Time. 

Become a member at https://plus.acast.com/s/fatmascara.

item.description:
Hairstylist Jawara is one of the most in-demand stylists in fashion today thanks to his creativity, speed, and expertise with ALL hair types. We discuss why the latter is still (!) a rarity in fashion, and how the industry can fix the problem. Plus, Jawara discusses #assistantlife, working with frequent collaborator Solange, the secret sauce in his bag, and his recipe for the sexiest cologne on earth. Before that: the business of being a beauty influencer, the Deciem kerfuffle, and beauty companies faking customer reviews.

Luke Henderson is back in the studio for a cozy beauty chat with Jess (Jenn is away this week), and all bets are off: We're talking celeb trends that just ain't working, $3 skincare secrets, product hoarding, Domino's pizza, the best spa in New York, Kate Middleton's beauty evolution, and lots of other dishy bits.

item.title: Ep 127: The Don
item.itunes:title: Ep 127: The Don
item.itunes:subtitle: John Demsey, Executive Group President of The Estée Lauder Companies, Inc., is one of the biggest decision makers in the beauty world (he oversees brands like MAC, Tom Ford, Too Faced, and GlamGlow), but he wasn't too busy to stop by our studio fo...
item.description:
John Demsey, Executive Group President of The Estée Lauder Companies, Inc., is one of the biggest decision makers in the beauty world (he oversees brands like MAC, Tom Ford, Too Faced, and GlamGlow), but he wasn't too busy to stop by our studio for a chat. Demsey talks about his early days on the Bloomingdale's fragrance floor, shares his number-one rule for entrepreneurs, passes on free advice from Leonard Lauder, and gushes about his nine (!) pets. Before that: Jess discusses fragrance shopping in Amsterdam, we decide if facial rollers are worth the hype, and we solve a small (but annoying) acne issue.


Want more Fat Mascara?

Paula Begoun—founder of Paula's Choice, author of Don't Go To the Cosmetics Counter Without Me, and basically the beauty industry's watchdog—is in the Fat Mascara studio to bust some beauty myths, explain what skincare ingredients can (and can't) do, and tell us how she really feels about sheet masks.
